1.review:
One of the consistent options in Hell's Kitchen. The appetizers are delicious. I've tried the chicken satay and the calamari salad. Great flavors and fresh ingredients. At first, it does seem slightly pricey for the portion, but the quality is definitely there.

I tried the Pad Thai for the main, which was tasty and a good-sized portion, but it was on the sweeter side (it didn't bother me, but just comparatively to other Thai restaurants). 

We also had the pumpkin sticky rice which is delicious. I still prefer mango, but this one felt less sweet and more custard-y. 

I've eaten in once and the place gets packed during lunch time, but the delivery is efficient as well.
1.name: Rebecca Lian

2.review: Small restaurant but with very delicious food. The atmosphere is great. The customer service is on point. I didn't try a lot of different meals so I will be back. Thanks to Teddy's guide for recommending me this lovely restaurant.
2.name: Peter Stones

3.review:
Our group (6 people) unanimously decided on this restaurant seeing the great reviews. We had a mixed experience. Pad Thai (both chicken and shrimp) and bowls were very good. Thai ice tea was delicious. Vegetarian dishes were bland and dry.
Servers were very friendly and ambience was homely. Definitely worth visiting again.
3.name: Nishant Kumar

4.review: Amazing! One of the highlights of our NYC visit. I heard the pork and crab dry noodles were their specialty and it didn't disappoint. My wife is vegan and loved the vegetable steamed dumplings. She also ordered the pad woo sen and enjoyed it as well. The place was clean and the service was excellent. Prices were reasonable ($40 for 2 noodle dishes and appetizer) and good portion sizes. There was a 45 minute wait at 9 pm on a Monday, but totally worth it!
4.name: Brian Fox

5.review: I visit this lovely place  a lot! This is my favorite spot to to have a good dinner.  I visit this place at least once a month. The cooking is great, the crew is friendly and the price is reasonable. I enjoy being in this place for a good supper.
5.name: Abram Avery

6.review: I love this small cozy Thai restaurant. It was the first time to eat Thai food, so I asked recommendation to the waitress. She nicely helped us with smile, showing food photos to understand me! The dried noodle with hot soup was really authentic. I love its vibe either. You should stop and try the tasty Thai food :)
6.name: Jimin Park

7.review:
A gem among a million Thai restaurants in Hell’s Kitchen. It is probably one of the pricier/priciest Thai restaurants in the area but also one of the best. You can’t go wrong with any of the dishes on the menu as they are all good from my experience. 

There are almost always a line except for maybe before lunch rush on the weekdays. Plates are relatively small but quality is top notch. The egg noodles with the pork and crab is phenomenal. Adding pork rind to almost anything you order will add a good crunch and extra delicious kick to any dish.
7.name: Canh Tran

8.review: Authentic, delicious dishes only equalled by the seamless service. Great looking place and noise level conducive for chatting (although your nearby neighbors may here!) Loved my meal here.
8.name: Anthony J. Avallone

9.review: So good! This was one of the best restaurants we went to while in NYC. Our group tried a variety of appetizers, drinks, and entrees. Everything was excellent. The chicken curry puffs were my favorite of the appetizers. The Thai coffee is great, and I had the Pad Kee Mao (Drunken Noodle) which was spicy and delicious. Definitely would go back.
9.name: Blakely Johnson

10.review: Amazing! Food was so fresh and delicious. Staff were lovely and friendly. Would definitely go again
10.name: Fleur De Lune

11.review: One of the best Thai food in the city! Great food, real authentic Thai master cooked. Speedy response, affordable price. Waitress were very nice. I love the spicy fried rice and the meat soup.
11.name: Vivian Fung

12.review: This place is an authentic Thai restaurant. The venue is pretty small and cute. We didn't have to make reservations and where seated right away. I ordered their infamous ratchaburi crab & pork dry noodles and it definitely lived up to expectations.It's expensive here, and even with smaller portion sizes, you're still paying a lot for what you get. Lots of meat dishes for the meat folk. The staff is excellent as well! I highly recommend this place.
12.name: Romeo Santos

13.review: AMAZING. Small seating area so we had to wait about fifteen minutes (not bad!) but excellent service; fastest I have ever witnessed! Within less than ten minutes of ordering, everyone in my party of four had their entrees. Food was very flavorful, and portion sizes were absolutely perfect. Food was very well priced for the portion.
13.name: Jacquelyn Chase

14.review: We visited on 9/10/19 and our experience was great.  We waited for about 20 minutes for a table.    The food was great and the staff was great.  They went out of their way to talk to our 3 year old.
14.name: Bennie Crowder

15.review: The absolute best Thai in the city for it's price point! Expect to wait for a table pretty much any time you go, but it's definitely worth it. Service is quick and efficient, but entirely impersonal, but it doesn't matter. It's that good!
15.name: A Thomas

16.review: Small intimate space with Thai music playing creates a fun atmosphere. I don't typically like small spaces, but was perfectly comfortable. Pad Thai was cooked nicely with delicious flavors. Reasonably priced.
16.name: Jonathan Olsen

17.review:
Whenever I'm in town, this is my go to for Asian cravings. It's simply one of the best Thai food I've had. It might even be better then what Thailand has to offer. 

If you're in the area I would recommend checking it out , but do reserve your tables as it's usually packed with people.

Order anything. They hardly mess up. :)
17.name: Toy Lim

18.review:
A-m-a-z-i-n-g!
Authentic atmosphere, super friendly and nice staff and even customers! 
You feel like you came to another world, where’s everyone super friendly and relax.
Food options make you want to come back again, because it’s hard to chose, you want to try everything.
Plum sake is delish and must try.
$8 glass of sake ($36 bottle)
$9 wine
$4.50-5 beer
$9-$12 meal
They have 3 levels of spice: medium, mild & hot
We had 
- Wok Basil with Chicken (mild) - super tasty and spicy but not to the crying point;
- Pad Thai with Shrimp (mild) - wasn’t spicy at all, would order hot next time.
- Vegetable dumplings with spinach inside is delicious (4pcs appetizer)
18.name: Ekaterina Spiridonova

19.review: Great Thai, small selection, got there about 9.45pm, short wait as packed, but worth waiting for.  Only comment is spicy could be a bit spicier, but there is chilli you can add.
19.name: Robert Brouwer

20.review: The beef pad see ew was good!  The wait wasn't nearly 20 min like they estimated (it was much shorter).  However, they did rush us out towards the end...
20.name: Vivian Lu

21.review: The wait for this place is really long! The place is tiny and it's really cramped; typical Manhattan but not very comfortable. Anyway, I got the Thai iced tea and the roast pork and crab homemade egg noodle. The Thai iced tea was a tad too sweet for me but it was creamy and had pretty good Thai tea flavor. The noodles had really good flavors too. The noodles were perfectly chewy and the pork was really tender. Everything was flavorful too, including the noodles, the roast pork, and the sauce in general. Portions are average, not too big. Prices are high though; my noodles were $16 pre-tax. Service was alright, nothing too out of the ordinary.
21.name: Andrea Wu

22.review:
Not so cheap, in my opinion as a thai food lover food is a little bit commercial and not authentic, maybe cause is in Manhattan but i think u can find definitely a better and authentic Thai restaurant in NYC.
Waited one hour for nothing..
22.name: Jacopo Lofyo

23.review: When we arrived there was quite a line, but we had to try this place out.  It was worth the wait!  The place is pretty small, but the atmosphere was fun and inviting.  We ended up sitting at the large round table in front and sharing with another couple, which was totally fine.  The curry puffs were perfectly crisp and had an amazing potato filling.  The pad se ew and dry noodles were so spectacular.  All the food was fresh and piping hot!  All was topped off with some cold sake.  Great place--we can't wait to come back!
23.name: Karl Lindsay

24.review: I had the shrimp stir fry and it was perfect. Seasoning, taste. Just very crowded.
24.name: Paulina Ryabko

25.review: Delicious thai cuisine at reasonable prices for NY standards. Fast, friendly service and the staff were great at recommending dishes. The food had unique, interesting flavors. My personal favourite was the baby back ribs!  The restaurant also has a cozy ambience and is situated in a good location. Definitely worth a visit!
25.name: Raja Johnpulle

26.review: Awesome Thai food. We tried two curry dishes, basal and pad Thai tofu and all were really really tasty. Seasoning is perfect although next time we will most likely try a spicier curry but still extremely well prepared and the pineapple pineapple pen fried rice is a must also.
26.name: Fayenan Pratt

27.review: Very authentic Thai place. Probably the best in Hell’s Kitchen. Love Thai basil chicken, pad see ew, sukhotai pork, calamari salad and so much more!
27.name: Daniyar

28.review: Small, cozy, and decently prized. I'm usually not a fan of dry noodles but this was the place that convinced it could still be delicious. Like coming here every so often.
28.name: Elizabeth Sun

29.review:
The environment here feels very homey. It made me feel relaxed and at home. The smells of the restaurant will starve you while you wait for your food.

They could definitely change the waiting area because its right beneath the coat hangers.

The food here is well priced. None of it comes too spicy. Instead you can over spice it yourself! Wouldn't recommend going with a large party. Groups of 4 would do well but any larger and the wait will be long.
29.name: William Guo

30.review: Great food! Long wait but always worth it.
30.name: Thitawan Tong Chaiwong

31.review: I eat a lot of Thai food, and this place is without a doubt the best Thai restaurant I've been to in Manhattan, and I've been to quite a few. It's a hole in the wall but the interior is actually quite lovely, with rustic decor, and smells that delight even before you taste the food.
31.name: Mark Philip Lichtenstein

32.review: I eat here fairly often. The service is excellent and the food is delicious. The chicken satay appetizer is very good. I recommend trying the curries, my personal favorite is the green curry, level 7. I have tried a few of the other dishes (pad Thai, etc) but they didn't dazzle, not bad just average. If you are looking for curry though this is the first place I would recommend.
32.name: Angela Ross

33.review: Excellent food. Pure Thai is a very small place with limited seating; be prepared to wait. There have been numerous times I would instead, order for takeout and schlep back to my place in Gramercy Park. It's a distance, but I always play mind games with myself, telling myself I've already burned the calories I'm about to consume. The chicken curry puffs are so good! Even though I always tell them not to include the cucumber salad (I hate vinegar stuff), they always add it...oh well...the curry puffs are so good...I usually toss the cucumber stuff in the trash on my way home...don't want it leaking. The spicy basil chicken is probably my favorite entree. The chicken satay is delicious! I've always experienced good service the times I've dined-in and ordered take-out.
33.name: Steve C 032

34.review: Very nice thai restaurant. Careful with the spices it can be very hit even for one or 2 stars.
34.name: Mark Maizonnasse

35.review: Great place for Thai in NYC!  It’s small, but between how fast they serve, how good the food is, and how well they turn the tables - stay! Wait in line!  Grab a Singha and read the menu.  You’ll regret walking out and getting one of the other Thai joints down the street.
35.name: Brian C

36.review:
Great place !
Delicious food with fresh ingredients that you can see at the entrance. 
Pad Thai Tofu is a perfect choice for vegetarians.
36.name: David Fernando Guajardo

37.review: This place was a on the whim decision. The food was very tasty and the servers were super nice. Will come back again when I am in town.
37.name: Dylan Fraser

38.review:
On a rainy Saturday afternoon, we were wanting something warm and spicy and this place delivered.  
While there are limited vegetarian options,  our server was able to suggest really good options.  The menu is simple and well marked in terms of what options there are for vegans.  
I had the spicy noodles with tofu and vegetables and they delivered.  The flavors were amazing. 
Service is spectacular, the decor is authentic and the dining experience was very pleasurable. 
I would happily dine here again.
38.name: N Maharaj

39.review:
Fantastic flavors in a small space

Pros: Every dish is delish, delivery is great

Cons: Space is tight
39.name: Josh S

40.review: Lovely atmosphere, and friendly service. I found our starters (satay and chicken curry puffs) to be more flavoursome than the main course of wok ginger curry with calamari - the sauce was a bit bland and had no heat or much aromatic stuff going on. However, it was still tasty and all the ingredients were succulent and fresh.
40.name: Steve Jones

41.review: Was looking for good quality food and not a tourist trap and I definitely found it! It felt a bit like a tiny restaurant/hole in the wall and it made the vibe ever better. Prompt service, food came pretty fast, and was totally delicious! It felt so tasty and authentic! The food also wasn’t oily which is always my biggest concern for noodles and stir fry. I highly recommend! My whole group just loved all the tastes and smells!
41.name: Hiba Al-Bahrani

42.review: Outstanding, some of the best Thai we've had in the city. Husband loved the crispy crab!
42.name: Zoe Samuel

43.review: Great lunch meal I had pad Thai and my wife had a curry dish. Both were tasty (not the best we have had but very good) great small location with friendly staff.
43.name: Matt Taylor

44.review: This should be the best Thai restaurant in the US. I am a kind of person who orders a favorate food over and over again, but here I really want to try everything on the menu. Authentic with good amount of spices and more importantly no funny twist. Can't wait til my next trip to NYC.
44.name: Kenneth Park

45.review:
Excellent Jungle Curry!

I visited here a few years ago and then came back yesterday for lunch with my wife since we were back in town. I have a gluten allergy so the waiter pointed out the Pad Thai, Jungle Curry, and a couple of other options.  It wasn't an extensive selection of gluten-free options but enough. I wasn't excited about any of them really but went with the Jungle Curry and it was Excellent. It was a large portion and I was sad when it was gone. 

My wife went with the Turmeric Chicken and was very pleased with it as well. Both dishes had the perfect amount of spice for us (spicy but edible) and the service was great. The only drawback of the place is it's super small so we felt a bit cramped but I'd go back anytime I was in the area and wanting Thai without hesitation.
45.name: Dustin Sutton

46.review: I was in New York for a week and was looking for a great Vietnamese shop. This pho place fit the bill! It was efficient, delicious and had great service. We ordered several entrees which tasted authentic and were appropriately priced. I would certainly come back here in the future!
46.name: Carlos Palmer

47.review: Great place to get Thai food, but be prepared to wait due to its small area. They have an online waiting list, so you can leave and come back when it's nearly done. The food itself was pretty good, and the spice level is not as bad as how they made it seem. While dining, the restaurant plays classic 80s style Thai music for a more "authentic" experience.
47.name: Henry Kim

48.review: really yummy thai place! the pad see yew has a very unique flavor. it’s sweet and savory at the same time. great portion sizes. we went on a friday at 6pm and got a table in about 20 minutes (were told the wait would be 30). unfortunately the crab fried rice was a little bland so had to add chili sauce—still VERY yummy and good quality. just as not flavor popping as the pad see yew. ambiance is fun. quite loud and cramped, and only stools, but it’s hoppin’.
48.name: Autumn P

49.review: Very delicious, authentic Thai flavours. Good balance of the four key flavours.. sweet salty sour spice. But their noodle dishes have the punchier flavour!! Definitely check this spot out. AMAZING baby back ribs appy.
49.name: Ryan Resmer

50.review: Consistency is key... after multiple visits, I've only ever had 5/5 wonderful customer service to report.  Thank you, Pho Basil, for offering such a reliable, delicious,r and warm respite from Boston weather.
50.name: Lois Patterson

51.review: Great Thai spot. Our drinks were delicious! Will be coming back!
51.name: kate dubitski

52.review: Excellent food and service. I felt like I was in Thailand again.
52.name: MS RS

53.review: Very good Thai food, I get the feeling it's hard to find Thai food in NYC and it isn't as popular as it is in Australia. But this small restaurant does a good job of it, very clean and very authentic Thai
53.name: Simone Famularo

54.review: I'm giving 2 starts for the hospitality! But the food was tasteless! I was expecting it to be the best but unfortunately it wasn't good at all! Food was really terrible!
54.name: Gayathri Sriram

55.review: Delicious food, and very accommodating even though they were very busy. Great restaurant!
55.name: Temple Duke

56.review: Lovely delicious food, rustic cozy environment with friendly staff
56.name: Akshay Patel

57.review: Compare to all other Thai restaurants with lower stars around this area, Pure Thai is overrated and overpriced. We had Paa Kee Mao and curry fried rice, both of them were mediocre.
57.name: Innuan Org

58.review: It’s a small place but serves delicious foods.
58.name: saki yamamuro

59.review: Oh man the roast pork and crab noodles are to die for. Found this place while looking for lunch (thanks google reviews! /shameless plug) and I ordered the Thai roast pork and crab noodles mainly from the pictures on their google review page. It did not disappoint. Great texture to the noodles and the sauce was a light tangy sweet sauce that Thailand is known for. On top of that we had the green papaya salad and the pad Thai which were all delish, but for me the star was the roast pork and crab noodles. So good I had to go back the next day!
59.name: Sheldon Tay

60.review: Food is great, wait can be long, service is alright
60.name: Kate Xin

61.review: Espectacular!!! Very little space at 9th , between 51-52th, 1 hour waiting, it worth it, Pad Thai, noodles with pork and crab, excelente The price acurate I want to come back soon
61.name: Karen Peer

62.review: Closest thing to Thailand on this side of world. The dry noodles with pork had generous piece of fresh crab. The fried chicken wings were nice and crisp with a side of sweet chilli sauce. The only thing I wasn't too crazy about were the ribs. It wasn't bad at all, but the flavor got tiring after eating so many of them. Over all this place is authentic and delicious. Would definitely come back.
62.name: sunny kim

63.review: Best pad see ew I've had in NYC. Also, spring rolls are the perfect texture.
63.name: Erika Finnimore

64.review: Great Thai food, fresh vegetables, lots of flavor. It's a small place with lots of tables. They move quickly so wait for a table if they are full. Our dinner was at our table in less than five minutes.
64.name: Jennifer Barrett

65.review: So easy to miss from the sidewalk. But glad I finally found it. Very tasty noodles. Quick service. But not alot of space.
65.name: Lisa Schnettler

66.review: I got the Chicken Pad Thai and it was out of this world. I wasn’t impressed with the chicken wings. Great portion size and very reasonable prices!
66.name: Brandi Garbutt

67.review: I ordered lunch takeout with the pork and crab ratchaburi Dry noodles, pad Thai with chicken and Thai iced tea. The dishes seemed alittle disappointing and wished the dry noodles had more sauce. The pad Thai was basic. Also, the Thai iced tea seemed too sweet. Maybe sit-down meals are better there...sadly they had no lunch special prices/deals.
67.name: Jennifer Lee

68.review: Small and busy place but worth a 20 minute wait. The food is delicious!!
68.name: Emily S

69.review: It was my first time trying thai food! The server recommended very good foods. She was very friendly ! I enjoyed all of them! Its kinda high price range but I highly recommended this place.
69.name: lisa kim

70.review: Had a craving for thai food so checked out this spot on Geary.  Customer service was excellent! The soup was perfect during this rainy San Francisco weather.  Their pad thai is also delicious!  Highly recommend this place!!  Definitely want to try their brunch!
70.name: Toby Patterson

71.review: Absolutely loved the quality of the food, we ordered the wings, dumplings, pad see ew with beef, and duck noodle soup. Simply delicious, each appetizer is about $10 and each entree is about $15. Cozy/tight seating. We would definitely go back.
71.name: Marie Rosario

72.review:
This place had amazing food. I came here for a quick meeting that turned into a long lunch with a great friend of mine and we had a blast. Super authentic food super authentic location in typical New York city type of dining with international cuisine.

Definitely would recommend definitely would say park around the corner because this place is worth it

Make sure to try out a few different dishes and the chicken wings, they were fantastic and in excellent excellent excellent appetizer

They were quick to seat us quick to serve and we had an excellent time. Thank you very much
72.name: Matt Ortolani

74.review: A great secret, little hole in the wall. Perfect sized portions and fast service.
74.name: Melissa Taylor

75.review: I’ve been to Pure Thai Cookhouse a few times now and every experience has been exceptional.  The ambiance is cozy and cool, the food is absolutely incredible, and the service is lightning fast.  It’s a tiny space, so there’s generally a bit of a wait for a table, but it’s completely worth it.
75.name: Shaina Higgins

76.review:
I went to Thai cookhouse with 2 friends for lunch and we enjoyed our food even though it wasn’t so tasty. The menu doesn’t offer a large variety of dishes (they don’t have masaman nor any curry dishes).
The place is cool and cozy and the staff is nice.

I’d like to try more dishes to have a better idea!
76.name: Kiara Di Paola

78.review: So my girlfriend and I went to see a show. We were in the theater area, so we were searching for a good spot to eat before the show. Neither one of us goes to many plays, so we were completely unaware of our options. Somebody on the street actually recommended this Pure Thai Cookhouse to us, and we didn't regret it. I've always been greeted fast and in a friendly way when I go to Thai restaurants, and this place was no exception. We got to a table pretty fast, and ordered within a few minutes. I had the best vegetable dumplings I have ever tried. They were so well-cooked, with a little crisp on the outside, and gooey on the inside. My girlfriend had some sticky rice and noodles, and was impressed with the quality of the grain and rice that they used. All in all, the meal cost us about 30 dollars for two diners, and we were full for our night in the theater. The waitstaff was really quick and efficient, and that stands out in my mind when I think back to my experience there. They were very fast and organized, but not in a way that felt pushy. I wholeheartedly recommend Pure Thai Cookhouse if you are going to a show or if you are just in the Hell's Kitchen neighborhood.
78.name: Matthew Hudson

79.review: So in love with the pad see ew at the spot. The best I ever had. Their that boat is good too with tons of flavor.
79.name: Amanda Cox

80.review: Great service and atmosphere and the food was definitely tasty. I like how there are loads of pescatarian options. It will get crowded at the place so definitely recommend that you make a reservation prior to heading there .
80.name: Xiao-fang Ruan

81.review: That's good experience. Be care.... spicy.
81.name: Frédéric Laurent

82.review: Very small restaurant that can get crowded but worth it for the fun atmosphere and good food. Pad Thai tasted really sweet, I loved it
82.name: Katie Carl

83.review: This is definitely one of the best Thai restaurants in the neighbourhood.
83.name: Uzair Haq

84.review:
One of the best Thai restaurants in the city. If you love Thai food and noodles, this is a must. My husband is so in love with one of the noodle dishes, he just ordered two portions of it. It’s that good. A must try if you are in the neighborhood.

The only downside is that this is no longer a hidden gem so the wait can be very long...I think it’s time for an expansion Thai Pure Cookhouse!
84.name: Tran Nguyen Duc

85.review: Just two blocks from the theatre district - this little Thai restaurant is great.
85.name: Kate Ensell

86.review: Pretty good, just the pad Thai was tasty and the chicken curry puffs were good. Would have given it higher if the Thai ice tea was more. Honestly $4 and it was almost literally half ice. You guys should have given more ice tea, this just feels like a rip off.
86.name: Tom Lu

87.review: Best Thai Restaurant! Taste so much like foods in Bangkok. I love their stir-fry flavor and spices and my friend loves their soup noodles esp flat noodles,  so silky !
87.name: Kate wu

88.review: Food is excellent. The service very friendly and there is a good atmosphere. I don't give 5 stars  only because of the....chairs!
88.name: Flavia M.

90.review: It is really good! My boyfriend never eats vegetable! It’s been such a headache for me! But, he ate the jungle curry fried rice, and gladly ate all of the vegetables in the plate( except the super spicy chili pepper and the lime), even the cucumbers! Thank you pure Thai cookhouse!
90.name: Leah Cheng

91.review: This place is a must if you ever find yourself in Hells Kitchen.  I had the Moa with squid and it was  delicious!
91.name: Gary Atkins

92.review: big food, cant have a once lol
92.name: 냥KW

93.review: Small place with very nice food moderate prices,  5 vegan items on the menu
93.name: Upmanu Lall

94.review: Small friendly cosy atmosphere.  The food is to die for. Very tasty and delicious.
94.name: Marjorie Bibbons

95.review: The best Thai food you will find outside Thailand. Everything on the menu is delicious and the service is awesome.
95.name: Jake S

96.review: Very good Thai restaurant! Try the Thai iced tea, with condensed milk. I also particularly enjoyed the wok curry calamari.
96.name: Alejandra Estanislao

97.review: Hands down the best and most authentic Thai food I have had since Thailand. Wow wow wow. The ramen is more of a Thai soup than a ramen, because you basically pick a curry base. I had the panang curry and it was one of the best I've ever had. Great for vegetarians and vegans.
97.name: William Hall

98.review:
Stellar food all around. Long wait both times I've tried to come here, so recommend planning for between 30-45 minute wait.

Great items:
- Wok Curry paste (substituted chicken instead of pork)
- Crispy tofu
- Papaya salad with crab (amazing raw crab)
- Chicken Satay with peanut sauce
- Thai iced tea & coffee
98.name: Robert Fertig

99.review: Great Thai spot in Hell’s Kitchen with many unique dishes not found in typical Thai restaurant menus. They have fantastic daily specials too. There’s almost always a wait because of their popularity. Many things are spicy but you can for most of them request a spicy level. However when we last went there, the dish that was level 3 (highest) spicy was milder than the one that we requested level 1 (mildest) and I couldn’t feel my mouth for a while after
99.name: W Y

100.review: Delicious food, cosy vibe and attentive servers.
100.name: Niv Pai

101.review: Have stopped in a few times over the years for lunch and never disappointed.  Everything on the menu is good, just pick the flavors to your taste.
101.name: Devin Mell

102.review: Very tasty papaya salad!  Nice spice. Worth a stop if you’re in the neighbourhood.
102.name: Andrew Millar

103.review: Awesome thai noodle quiet fast and very nice service! The only negative thing is the restaurant is small and tables are very close to each other, but if you are fine with it, it's absolutely a worthy.
103.name: MI SEON Kim

104.review: Seemed totally authentic.  Very small restaurant with backless stools at most tables.  Crowded and loud.  The food however was excellent.
104.name: Jeffrey Macklis

105.review:
Got the steamed beef buns. They were decadent! Highly recommend appetizer for two.
Had the pork and peanut dish, got medium done, and it was plenty spicy for my palette.
Food is as good as the service.
105.name: Brett Bernier

106.review:
Really good Indian food......

Just picked up a few random dishes for a work party and it was a hit!!!!!
106.name: Virginia Nunez

107.review: Really enjoyed the Goi salad, the one with cabbage and other vegetables. We had it with tofu, which was super soft and crispy on the outside. I had the Khao Soi, the northern style curry noodle dish with fried chicken. Tremendous!
107.name: Emilio Clarke

108.review:
My favorite thai restaurant, maybe my favorite restaurant period. If you can handle the spice, the jungle curry fried rice is out of this world. 

No matter what you order, the service is the fastest I've ever experienced outside fast casual. 

Pure Thai gets 10/10 & 100/100
108.name: Joseph Rubino

109.review: After all of these years, still the best.
109.name: Joel Leventhal

110.review: Excellent food. The staff was very friendly and helpful! Setting and atmosphere are very nice too :)
110.name: Loïc Nyffenegger

111.review: My friends and I were in the mood for Thai before our show. The staff were very friendly and efficient. I loved the music and the overall vibe of the place. I had pad Thai with shrimp because I was hesitant to eat very spicy food before my show, but it was the best I’ve ever had. We also split spring rolls which were very tasty. I’d recommend this place to anyone and would love to go back. This restaurant was unbelievable. The food was delicious, the service was friendly and quick and the prices were unbelievably good value! The seasonal soft shell crab was the best I’ve ever had. We then feasted on a variety of other appetisers which were equally good. For mains, I loved the pad Thai, but my friend had the roast pork and crab egg noodles and said they were fantastic. Would definitely recommend this for couples or families.
111.name: Simon Vozovski

112.review: The best Thai food in New York, hands down! The spring rolls are delicious and their Thai Tea is perfect! However, The red curry is the best I've had from any where in there U.S...no lie!Great prices and awesome service!
112.name: Penny Steele

113.review: Best Thai Beef salad I ever ate! Thank you for a nice meal on our last day in NYC
113.name: zzizahacallar

114.review: Excellent food served by very nice and polite staff. We were a group of 4 and had a great time tasting each other's delicious plates.
114.name: Massimo Strino

115.review: Delicious meal in a small place with great prices!
115.name: George G. Ortiz-Mejias

116.review: Pure Thai has the best Thai food in all of Manhattan!!! Fair price (for New York) and they give you very generous portions! Highly recommend the Pad Thai (can't go wrong) or Pad Kee Moa!
116.name: Donny Ta

117.review:
I visited on Monday evening for dinner with another friend. There was a wait of 20 minutes. Inside is very small like a size of hallway, so it feels a bit squeezed and could be loud. They did have small waiting area at the entrance. 
.
I had Ratchaburi Crab and Pork Dry Noodles. The pork tasted amazing and went along well with the crab meat. I think it had some fish sauce which gave light sweetness. 
.
We shared chicken curry puffs and crispy tofu. They were also good but chicken curry puffs were not as crispy as other places.
117.name: Chan Woo Park

118.review: Love thus place, you have to be patien if you want to get a table for dinner but it is very worth it
118.name: Norma Gallardo

119.review: Definitely one of the best thai food I've had in my life. The dishes are very tasty, and I would highly recommend taking a dessert as well. The staff is like, super nice.
119.name: Colin Castori

120.review: Totally legit food. Full of flavor, authenticity, and energetic vibe.
120.name: Jason Jeong

121.review: Pure Thai is awesome, authentic Thai food. The long wait times are the only bummer.
121.name: Mark Seward

122.review: Small place but food was incredibly delicious, we would like to visit again n again
122.name: Snehal Desavle

123.review: I had the fried chicken, pad see ew, and the coconut juice. Everything was amazing, the Thai food was authentic and delicious! The space is small and sometimes you have to share a table! Worth the trip and the wait!
123.name: Paula Chau

124.review: Food is pretty good,the taste like I ate in Thailand. but service is just soso.not good.not bad,but they do things like you should go,bcs they are busy.
124.name: 纽约霹雳狗

125.review: I came here 4 times ordering different food. They surprised me every time, the food is super amazing. The service is excellent, and don't forget the thai tea!
125.name: Monica Caron

126.review: Whenever I eat somewhere else I wonder why I didn't eat here. Krabi for the win.
126.name: Aslan Crawley

127.review: We walked 2 miles only to discover this placed is closed by the health commission! July 19th.
127.name: Chris Kirkwood

128.review: Excellent Thai food! The chicken pad kee mao was clearly a notch up from your typical Thai restaurant (also spicier).  The pork noodle soup though was incredible. The broth was savory with hints of sweetness and it just tasted so good. Also the waitress was super nice and friendly.
128.name: Kelvin Niu

129.review:
A great little find near the Hell's Kitchen area of NYC. The restaurant is quite small, I would recommend making reservations in advance. I only needed a table for 1 during my visit, so I was able to grab a seat at the bar. I ordered the pork buns and the pad thai. Both were quite delicious and were served in sizable portions. After finishing my meal, I ordered a Thai iced tea to go so I could enjoy it as I continued to tour the city.

This is definitely a great hidden gem and worth the stop if you're in the area.
129.name: Orielle M.G.

130.review: Friendly, bustling...no wonder...Great food...the homemade noodles are 😋 delicious!
130.name: mary fusco

131.review: I love my Thai the way I love my vodka.
131.name: Joshua Paul Weckesser

132.review:
Really mixed on this place as service was decent and ingredients were good quality. 

Unfortunately it's not authentic at all. I'm fine with "American" Thai food, but this place markets itself as authentic and very clearly states on the menu that the dishes are wok-cooked. They are not. Real stir fry requires large (100k+ btu) burners and the ingredients are seared very quickly giving that delicious seared on the outside, fresh on the inside flavour.

They don't have the burners and they don't use real woks. The result is pad thai, et al that is just not right.

So if you like American style Thai lacking any char, go for it. If you have want something remotely correct, go elsewhere.
132.name: Brian R

133.review: Have ordered from them three times. It's always fast and fresh and delicious. I would recommend this to anyone who enjoys Thai food.
133.name: Alma Garza

134.review: This is a small Thai Restaurant. We had to wait for 20 min. For a table but it was worth. We had the steamed beef dumplings, Fried Tofu and the Pad... Ew ;) it was delicious. If we ever come back to New York we will go there again.
134.name: Andreas Wagner

135.review: This tiny place is amazing. Oh I wish I had this where I lived, I'd go once a week at least.  Spring roles and pad Thai were fantastic, best I've ever had. Very convenient system of texting you when your table is ready
135.name: Donna Huffstater

136.review: Yes yes yes the best Thai food that I've ever tried. It is amazing totally recommended. By the way I used Yelp to find this restaurant we had to wait like 40 minutes but it is worth it. Pad Thai and pork dry noodles were amazing!!!!
136.name: Devon Jacinth

137.review: Very authentic! Beautiful flavors and excellent service and atmosphere. I will be going again but with more people! Get there early because they get pack right from opening.
137.name: Nathaniel Nemdharie

138.review: Very small space, I missed it at first when I walked by. Pad Thai and vegetable spring rolls were excellent. This place fills up quick so be prepared to wait or settle for a seat at the “bar”
138.name: Jessica Robinson

139.review: Good service,good food but too crowded, fast service.This the best restaurant for Thai noodle .I love Thai ice tea.
139.name: narischa rattana

140.review: Awesome authentic food. Really enjoyed the food
140.name: Gokul A

141.review: We couldn't remember our last visit but Pure Thai Cookhouse is still the best, and it's even better when it's been awhile cause it makes you appreciate them even more. it's one of the few times we wished we lived in NY.
141.name: Joan Alsop

142.review:
In know every review wants to start with "authentic" but this really is. 
Great Jungle curry along with staples like Pad Thai. The Thai iced tea cools nicely and the desert rice is yummy.
142.name: Stephen Harman

143.review: We waited about 45 minutes for a table because it’s a small, busy place. But it was beyond worth it. The spring rolls were amazing with the plum sauce, the curry puffs were yummy, and the pad Thai was out of this world. To top it all off, the Thai iced tea😍 I will be dragging my bf back here from CT very soon to go again.
143.name: Brianna Love

144.review: The food is amazing. It's kinda small but the food comes out quickly.
144.name: Andrew Reiff

145.review: LOVE Phad Thai. My wife and I eat here frequently.
145.name: John Ferullo

146.review: Amazing food and gorgeous ambiance. We got the crab and pork noodles which was a very flavorful and aesthetic dish. Would definitely come back.
146.name: Cindy C

147.review: The food is great and the service is fast. Will definitely come back here again
147.name: Alex Menarini

148.review: This was my first visit to NYC and I am a real foodie. Visited this place after reading positive reviews. The staff is very welcoming and pleasant. We had ordered Chicken Pad Thai. Did not like it as it was too oily. I would rate the staff as 10/10. The food for the price would be 5/10. Wouldn’t recommend.
148.name: Abdul Kadar Bookwala

149.review:
Tasty Thai food and great prices.  Very friendly staff in a restaurant with nice atmosphere.  

Staff are Thai so the food is indeed authentic, at least with the ingredients available locally.
149.name: Heiko Gehrig

150.review: Best Thai in Hell’s Kitchen is not the whole island of Manhattan! It’s amazing food! Go try it! Make sure to wait because this place is great.
150.name: Jonathan Decker

151.review: Best Thai food I have ever tasted.  Great service too.  Ordered a take out because I could not wait 40mins for a table - my choice.  Food is fresh, perfectly seasoned and so tasty.
151.name: ayotola jagun

153.review:
Suuuuuuuch a good find!
We stumbled upon this place by accident while trying to find a dinner place before sering the Book of Mormon, and I was ecstatic to have found it.
I am the biggedt fan of thai food, and I've been obsessed since I went there in 2017, so I can actually say this place remains true to it's origins! From the flavor, the presentation and the locale itself.
Definitely should go there if you're around! Just beware you mught have to wait awhile as it's usually pretty busy!
153.name: Sabrina Scholkowski

154.review: A very solid Chicken Pad Thai for takeout. Would definitely come back and dive deeper into the menu.
154.name: Marshall Shaffer

155.review: One of the most authentic Thai food around. They greet you with simple "สวัสดีค่ะ" which ganrantee you at the door that they're authentic. They serve many foods that are common in Thailand but for some reason many Thai restaurants in the U.S don't serve. If you want a real taste from Thailand, this one is the closest you'll get. The place is small and very quaint compared to other Thai restaurant. But the style of the place reminded me of a vintage noodle shop in Thailand. If you are going to Thailand soon, test your taste buds here.
155.name: noname22541

156.review: Noodle soup is so so ....but the Roit curry is super good!!!!!!! The price is ok~~I will come again ,,,try another things ..
156.name: Latoya Hamblin

157.review: First time here..fast and friendly service! I had the pad Thai/spicy noodle lunch special. Tasty!
157.name: Mary Alexander

158.review: Great Thai food, with some unique dishes. I would recommend the duck noodle soup, it has some great flavors l hadn’t tasted before! I would love to come back.
158.name: David Kanter

159.review: Loved the food here so much I went twice last week! 😋 Most autehtic and the best Thai in NYC! X
159.name: Peter Elton

160.review: Wait was about an hour for 4, which we expected.  We heard great reviews & probably just had high expectations. We ordered spring rolls,  that were tasty, but I've had store bought spring that taste exactly the same. I ordered the Pad Thai & My husband ordered the vegetable stir fry plate (forgot the name). His tasted bland and my plate was really sweet. Our friends also didn't like their plates. At the end the waitress was hovering over us when it was time to tip... which just made it awkward.
160.name: Silvana de Jesus

162.review: Didn't expect the experience to  lack clarity of ingredients, i wanted a dish served with tiger shrimp and had to settle for chicken. The host that seated us assured that a dish could be made. The restaurant was small and crowed, would suggest trying a different thai restaurant.
162.name: eugene frazier

163.review: Great food. Recommend cinnamon beef kebab. I like tech so I dig the touchscreen menus they have. Dinner with one of the coolest dates.
163.name: P Enock

164.review: Good ambient and efficient service.  Food is good and the portion is satisfying.
164.name: B W

165.review: Authentic Thai and so diff from all those generic Thai restaurants that litter NYC. There's always a long wait so just come by yourself and eat at the counter or takeout.
165.name: Heejin Kim

166.review: One of the best place in new York to have authentic Thai food
166.name: Vishal Malapati

168.review: Amazing food. Everyone is friendly. It's a quick turn around as it gets super busy. Since it's very small inside there isn't a lot of space for bigger parties.
168.name: TheSuperSanchez

169.review: Cozy little restaurant  with great food and lots of flavor. They play Thai rock music! So fun!
169.name: Amberly Lynn

170.review: The food was great. The pad thai was too sweet for my taste, but I guess that's how it is supposed to be, at least in the US. The service was good.
170.name: Juan P. R.

171.review: Authentic Thai food at good prices!
171.name: Karolina Dróżdż

172.review:
Stumbled across this gem after seeing a show.  They were still running a 45 minute wait at 9:30pm.  It was worth it.  Get the Steam Buns and Pad See Ew.  Going to be dreaming about this meal for weeks.  

Word to the wise...The place is only about 10’ wide and you will share space with strangers.
172.name: Julie Dodd

173.review: Fantastic authentic Thai food. I could not have been happier. I got tofu vermacelli and it was spicy and flavorful. Service is quick. It's crowded but the atmosphere is nice and it doesn't feel cramped.
173.name: Max Max

174.review: The restaurant stayed true to authentic Thai flavours! It's definitely worth the long wait in the queue. Ba Mi Moo Daeng (noodles topped with crab and chinese 5 spice-roasted pork) is not to be missed.
174.name: Waswate Ayana

175.review: Delicious Thai food in NY. Was full in few minutes after opening in morning.
175.name: Mukul Gupta

176.review: I love Thai cuisine, it is one of my favorites. After flying round to Bangkok and Phuket on Thai Airways and eat Thai food for almost two weeks I become a fanatic of this delicious Asian food.
176.name: Zulma Faiad

177.review: Quaint location and the service and food were exceptional. Spring roll appetizer (5), Pad Thai, green curry daily special  and 2 beers were only $53.   Outstanding value for the amount and quantity as we couldn’t eat it all.
177.name: Jeff Montgomery

178.review:
Great food, excellent service, decent prices.
Dishes are not big but definitely enough.
178.name: Elad Koren

179.review: Excellent, delicious food, good service. As we arrived, we were asked to wait until all the group arrive too (which is understandable), however, when you we asked to sit and one of the our friendly join 20 minutes later, they told us that it's impossible, even if we are ordering for him (to save time). That cause us to choose between our table to our friend (that was already on his way). We didn't like this policy of them. That gives us bitter start.
179.name: Sapir Elmaliah

180.review: Great food ... Small space and a bit of a wait... But good service and great Thai food
180.name: Michael Ragone

181.review: Awesome thai food. Can't go wrong with any dish. Made a wrong choice by saying we want spicy food. Oh the food was tasty but it was spicy. Medium hot should be preferred. Never knew thai peppers can be so tasty and hot.
181.name: Donette Hayes

183.review: Wowza, this place was phenomenal. Had some delicious chili pepper chicken. Service was prompt and everyone treated us lovely. Not sure what the other recent reviewer did do to receive the service they did, but I loved this place. We had a great experience here. Absolutely recommended.
183.name: Ryan M.

184.review: Yes yes yes the best Thai food that I've ever tried. It is amazing totally recommended. By the way I used Yelp to find this restaurant we had to wait like 40 minutes but it is worth it. Pad Thai and pork dry noodles were amazing!!!!
184.name: Miguel Velasquez

185.review: Very good food. Red Thai curry was amazing! A bit expensive though.
185.name: Anurag Sai

186.review: best thai in New york without a doubt
186.name: John Livanos

187.review: Best Thai food in the city! The curry pasta pork/chicken, chicken puffs, most of the noodle dishes, and satay are excellent!
187.name: Pranav Shanbhag

188.review: Specials are bomb and stir fries are delicious.
188.name: Siddharth Sharma

189.review: Really tasty and also healthy food.
189.name: George Meressa

190.review: I'd recommend you try noodle soup. It's sound and spicy and can be a great option. Need to book table in advance and waiting time can be 30 mins
190.name: Anh Thu Do

191.review:
Very fresh ingredients and very delicious food. 
This restaurant is very original with Thai music all along your stay. 
We really enjoyed and during our 4 days stay we were here twice. 
Homemade egg noodles is made fresh every day. 
In both days we found a table even without reservation. If go for dinner maybe it would be a good idea to make a reservation though. 
For me one of the best Thai restaurant ever!
191.name: Andrea Giorgi

193.review: its worth the wait. get the wings!
193.name: Wayne Law

194.review: A bit cramped, but good food. Enjoyed the pumpkin dessert.
194.name: Eric Soderstrom

195.review: The dish I had - crab and pork noodle - had a good flavor but was a bit too sweet for my liking.
195.name: Phi Ha

197.review:
Small and cozy atmosphere inside, with fast and friendly service. This is a perfect spot to eat something warm and comforting on a rainy or cold day. 

We ordered the Chicken Curry Puffs and beef buns to start and they were both delicious and filling. The Chicken Curry Puffs are something I would definitely order again! The crust was delicate and flaky and the filling was thick with a perfect amount of spicy curry flavor. 

Everything everyone ordered for main dishes looked amazing and tasted great. It all seemed very fresh and it was a perfect way to warm up from the weather.  I ordered the Pad Kee Moa with chicken and it had the perfect level of heat that I was hoping for. The dish is definitely not for those who dislike spice, but they can adjust spice levels when you order.
197.name: Dana Vogel

198.review: This tiny Thai restaurant has great Thai food! Liked papaya salad, pork bun and fried flat noodles, but since there are not many tables the wait was long.
198.name: Koda Ko

199.review: Very small place but the food was very delicious. It's a little noisy (music playing loudly) but our food was prepared very quickly and was tasty.
199.name: Michael Thomas

200.review: Definitely amongst the favorite Thai spots in Hell’s Kitchen. The noodles are super flagrant and tasty.  Recommend the beef noodle or the duck noodle. You can even choose the type of noodle you want. Appetizers recommended include baby back ribs, chicken wings, and papaya salad. Also enjoy a Thai iced tea, coconut juice, or traditional Thai beer (Chang)
200.name: Dan Chiu

201.review: Food is delicious and restaurant has a great Thai atmosphere. Would go again :)
201.name: Peter Pang

202.review: Our favorite Thai place in Manhattan. Every time we visit New York we eat here at least once if not twice. Such a great little place.
202.name: Scott Starkweather

203.review: This place is a complete scam! Completely horrible service!! I'm extremely disappointed with my entire experience there! I came in with a party of three. We were all fasting since we came during the month of Ramadan and during this time of fasting we traditionally break our fast with dates and water. As we were waiting for the appropriate time to eat, I offered my friends ONE date to break the fast. The moment I took out my tiny bag of 3 dates our waitress told us that we couldn't bring outside food. She didn't say it politely, she was actually yelling at us! We all explained to her that it's the month of Ramadan and that's what we do. The waitress wouldn't give us a chance to speak. Mind you we ordered so much food for the three of us. But we put the one date away. We ordered 3 plates of pad Thai, 3 orders of spring rolls, 1 order of dumplings and 3 Thai iced teas. The entire time we were there, not only our waitress but every single waiter was eyeing us down to the point I was extremely uncomfortable eating my food. I was confronted about putting too much hot chili flakes on my food. The waitress told me that they make it themselves and asked if I really needed to use that much. Why are you watching me eat? When it came time to pay the bill we said that we would spit the check so the waitress left and came back with 3 separate checks with the same amount of money. When we did it on our phones the waitress added an extra $2 per check to the total amount so an extra $6 bucks plus we had to give a tip. When I asked for the original receipt she wouldn't give it to us!! Complete scam! I do not recommend this place to anyone unless you want to get discriminated against and scammed!
203.name: rima salem

204.review: Delicious authentic Thai food with a cozy atmosphere. It can be a little claustrophobic at peak, but is worth it for the food!
204.name: Nick Miceli

205.review: Tiny restaurant and cheap with good Thai options. They only lack of options for dessert. Service was pretty fast.
205.name: Carlos Villavieja

206.review: I was taken here while traveling with a co-worker who eats Thai every time I'm with him. He's taken his family here 3 times. I don't spend enough time in NYC to know if it's the best in the area, but I can say that it was really excellent.
206.name: Jeff Maddocks

207.review:
Posted this on yelp as well: I came here yesterday during lunch and ordered the Spicy Vegetable Pad Kee Mao for takeout. The food came out in 5 minutes despite the restaurant being crowded, which was nice. The food was okay but if you're going there to order that, you're better off going somewhere else. There are other Thai places on 9th Ave that could make that dish better in my opinion.

The reason why I'm giving them one star is not because of the food but because one of the hostesses was really rude. I originally tried to order the Shrimp Pad Kee Mao. I asked the hostess if it was possible for them to take the shell off the shrimp. This is something I ask every time I order this dish, and I eat Pad Kee Mao every time I go to a Thai restaurant. She responded in a very rude and condescending way "No, you can do that yourself. We can't do that here. We're too busy to do that here, you can do that yourself." In my opinion, her response could have stopped at "no." This response and the way she said it was very rude and unnecessary. Again, I've asked this question at multiple restaurants before, some busier than them. Some have said "yes" and others have said "no" but none have been as rude as this woman. 

I didn't respond to her comment but my friend and I continued to order because we walked pretty far to get to the restaurant and we were hungry. Because the mediocre food and rude hostess, this is not a place I will ever visit again. Hope you have a better experience.
207.name: Cheryl Liburd

208.review: Love the food and the place! Very delicious food & fast & nice service!
208.name: Christian Olivier Merz

209.review: This place was amazing!!! The food was delicious 😋It is a very small restaurant so make sure to get there knowing that. You can leave your phone number and go get a drink. Great service and cute atmosphere. Very tight though but worth the wait and crowded area! So good. I definitely recommend this place😁
209.name: Camille Rose

210.review: Love this place. Delicious authentic food in an intimate fun setting. A nyc fav.
210.name: Andrew Means

211.review: Worth the wait. Once you're seated, service is fast and food is fantastic.
211.name: Jayson Goldman

212.review: This was yummy. Being a proper Thai restaurant they have loads of gluten free options. Everyone was so kind and the entire staff seems to take care of everyone. Fresh food and ingredients. We'll be back
212.name: Avi Smith-Rapaport

213.review:
Ordered the Beef noodles and Thai iced tea. No doubt the best thai noodles in NYC - must try! Came here at 4pm for lunch, and the restaurant is almost full. (Wow)
Would definitely come back for dinner!
213.name: Sammi Wong

214.review: Line outside the door waiting for the restaurant to open for lunch. I ordered the seafood salad and the green curry. Both were fantastic!
214.name: Adam

215.review: Delicious food, one of the best Pad Thai I ever had. We had variety of dishes and they were all excellent. Very small place and wait time could be an issue when busy. There is no Wi-Fi. Excellent service. Prices are very decent.
215.name: N Laurencic

216.review: Wow, cannot be missed, food and staff are exquisite, only small restaurant and had to wait 30 mins but hey that was worth the wait.
216.name: Brian Miller

217.review: I love this place. Their pad thai is delicious. There’s often a wait, but it’s understandable - the place is tiny. Their delivery service works well too, but food is obviously always better at the restaurant. Giving 4 stars only because I noticed they recently got a B rating - seems like they need to work on cleaning issues! Disregarding this, I highly recommend this place.
217.name: Silvia Sebben

218.review: One of the best Thais in the city - super delicious and we have never been disappointed
218.name: Stefan Dobler

219.review: Awesome Pad See Ew - maybe the best I've ever had (order with medium spice)! Spring rolls and chicken wings were great! So many things I'd like to try on the menu. We hope to try it again soon!
219.name: don maxwell

220.review: One of the best Thai restaurants in the city. Can’t go wrong! Worth the wait! Really love the ratchaburi crab + pork dry noodles!
220.name: Soohan Han

221.review:
A hidden gem. Well maybe not that hidden since it is on several top 10s. Still it will not disappoint assuming you get there early enough to get a table. The crowd is also very friendly, our neighbours even let me try their pad Thai.
The dishes are authentic and amazing. The prices also won't set you back on your rental payment. Highly recommended.
221.name: Antonio Fortes

222.review: This place it is simply awesome,  I love it, every time that I go to NY, I go to eat there, the food is so delicious
222.name: nelly rubii

223.review:
If you have no time to go to Thailand, then come here and try one of the best traditional Thai food!! Not only is food as awesome as in Thailand, but the service is also nice and friendly!! I strongly recommend beef salad and the "Ractchaburi noodles”
.
.
Update: The service is just so friendly with their big smile. It’s aways a happy time to come here :)
223.name: Nicha Sukittiyanon

224.review: This place is phenomenal! Both my husband and I loved our dishes. The service was quick too! Great authentic Thai food!
224.name: Rebecca Lucero

225.review: Soooooo gooood! Try this place! No reservations allowed so went in and gave phone number for text when table was ready...about 35 mins. Communal seating in some locations. Fast service. Food was phenomenal - try the curry puffs for sure.
225.name: Jasmine Brewer

226.review: It's a small place in hell's kitchen so I usually wait at least 20 minutes to be seated but it's all worth it. The food is delicious and so fresh. I love their noodles so much! If you are around times square, theatre district and crave for Thai food, I definitely recommend!
226.name: Min Park

227.review: Amazing authentic thai food. Very spicy so evaluate your comfort level before you attempt!
227.name: Dee Patel

228.review: Amazing food great value, came here after Chicago at the Ambassador
228.name: Ellie C

230.review: Good Thai food obviously made with fresh products. Quite a small place, but when I went there it was crammed! Pre-ordered the food by phone, it was ready in a quarter of an hour. The staff was efficient and helpful. They have a specialty of home made noodle that are well worth it.
230.name: Eric Broneer

231.review: Good location near Broadway. Good for spicy food. Visited based on the high rating review. Very crowded place, small table & bar. They give stool for sitting. Do not take reservations. Rude hostess,  & service. Staff has attitude.
231.name: Pinakin Mistry

232.review:
Small dining room, but they do takeout.  The tofu here is the best I've ever had.  They must make it differently, because the texture is less slippery and a bit spongey. 

As for spiciness, the "medium" is what most restaurants call "extra spicy."  Approach with caution and plenty of fluids
232.name: Allison Saito

233.review: I ordered the duck noodle soup, and it was delicious! The soup was nicely flavored, but I like a little heat to my food and added a few spoonfuls of the chili powder on the table. Beware: that stuff is spicy! Still enjoyed the noodles, the soup, the duck, and the veggies. A nice decent amount of protein left me happily full. The space itself is small and cozy so expect a wait if you come at peak times.
233.name: David La

234.review: I found this to be a great lunch spot. Service is very friendly
234.name: Ziad Iskandar

235.review: Get the lunch specials, they are a better deal and just as tasty.  I got their pad thai with calamari to go.  Calamari and pad thai?  That's pretty unusual.  The food was definitely tasty and ordering online was super easy, took less than 10 minutes for order to be ready for pick up.  The only thing is: too much disposable one-time use plastic.  They even put a slice of lime in it's own plastic cup container.  All the trash generated from this one meal made me feel pretty guilty.
235.name: Lin Gan

236.review: Always have to stop by here every time I come to nyc ,this place is really good Thai noodle.
236.name: summer jene

237.review: One of the best Thai restaurants in the city.
237.name: Yukiyo Otsuka

238.review:
I got a tom-yam-kung noodle, papaya salad and pat-thai noodle. Those were really good!
Good portion, super busy, cool staffs.
I’ll go try another one soon.
238.name: Eugena Won

239.review: Satisfyingly authentic, Pure Thai lives up to its name. Flavors and spices are absolutely perfect, and they're completely willing to turn up the heat!
239.name: Arun Kochhar

240.review: Delicious, food was prepared excellent.  Only downside was the size of the restaurant
240.name: Lisa McDermott

241.review: Great location. Nice staff. Tasty breakfast.
241.name: Charles Hickey

242.review: Given the confined space and the sheer amount of people they pump through this place. The food is very solid. Honestly, authentic as it can be for being in NY. Is it the best, remains to been seen... But if you are looking for a quick Thai fix. This will do it for you....
242.name: MJL

243.review: Oh my god, f’n delicious! Will be back!
243.name: Birna Elínardóttir

244.review: My favorite Thai restaurant in NYC!! I just wished it was bigger. This is not a good place to bring a large group and be prepared to wait 45-60 minutes. But the food is super tasty so regardless, I keep coming back.
244.name: Bianca Ng

245.review:
A very cute small Thai restaurant on the border of Times Square.  If you’re craving noodles, come here instead of Ippudo.  

I ordered the Krabi Noodle soup.  My favorite part of the dish was actually the rice noodle.  It was perfectly cooked, just the right texture. I’m not a fan of the fish ball, though the thinly sliced fish cake was pretty good.  The soup also come with 2/3 big shrimps and some calamari pieces.
245.name: mydiemho

246.review: Horrible service the wait was ridiculously long  110 minutes and ended up with no tables... Highly recommend the staff to improve their communication and be considerate of customer's time. What is the point of going to eat out to get frustrated with poor customer service... We waited for 2 hours because they kept saying another 15 MN ... of course it is very common in New York restaurant scene to end up in this situation but it is all about how the restaurant adresses it. Here it was a joke.... and they did not even seemed bothered
246.name: sandra vedadi

247.review: Their dry noodle with charsu and crab meet is my favorite. Food comes fast. They are always very flexible with customer’s special requests which is a huge plus.
247.name: Minglu Li

248.review:
Excellent food, super tasty! 
The environment is great, but be prepared to wait for a spot.
248.name: Vitoria Calil

249.review: This restaurant serves excellent Thai food. We visited the place two times during our NYC trip and we have never been disappointed. The staff was friendly and very fast. It feels like they have about the same number of employees as there are guests in the restaurant. But everything is organized perfectly and very efficiently. Our food was served after 2 minutes and it was very fresh and hot. The place is quite small and it was always crowded. However, people don't stay long in the restaurant so you don't have to wait long to be seated. The restroom was clean and so was the kitchen (you can have a look inside the kitchen while you are in the line for the restroom). We paid $14 for fried rice with chicken and about the same amount for a stir-fried wok dish with shrimps. Portions had normal to big size. All in all, I would recommend to visit the place.
249.name: A. Hoffmann

250.review: Every time I’m in the city, Pure is a must stop! Food and service and impeccable. Can be busy at times but food is worth the wait! Chicken pad Thai and Ratchuburri pork and crab is to die for and as well as the ribs! Don’t forget your Thai iced teas as well!
250.name: Andy Mendoza

251.review:
Best thai place in the neighborhood. Always packed so expect to wait in line. 
Poor AC so it can get really hot inside.
251.name: Ray Yang

252.review: Very fast service, delicious food, good prices and portions. They have most of the classical Thai dishes, but I was missing Panang curry. The decor and tables are simple, but comfi. Definitely not a classy place. Seating is very limited, since this is a genuine hole in the wall. They also appear to have a very popular delivery service as judged by the bike delivery folks constantly zipping through the restaurant. The only dislike is that there is a constant bombardment of Thai pop at a pretty high volume. It is still possible to have a conversation without yelling. The music seems to resonate very well with the younger crowd this restaurant attracts.
252.name: Thomas Kusch

253.review: Genuine Thai cuisine. Excellent food. Busy small premises.
253.name: Andre Constantin

254.review: Spicy Thai food! Usually a wait to get a table.
254.name: Dusty Hill

255.review: I will absolutely use this company ever again beacause my experience was fabulous  and I recommend them at all. Thank You!!
255.name: Kyle Malfoy

256.review: Excellent food. We 5 of us went there for lunch.  The service was quick too.  It's a small place and we ended up sitting at the bar.  I will go back again.  Very reasonably priced and portions were big too.
256.name: Nathan Paki

257.review: I almost cried as soon as I had a bite of Pad Thai. It was awesome, amazing and speechless. I’m not a noodle person, so when I have even good noodles, I usually can’t finish one serving on my own. However, this was literally the first time I finished my noodle dish by myself. The combination of ingredients was amazing. Definitely worth visiting again. There was a waiting line but I only waited 10mins since I went there by myself.
257.name: Dani Choi

258.review: Wow! A must-try! Some of the best Thai food I've ever had. Their delivery is insanely quick, too.
258.name: Drew Davis

259.review: Very convenient, easy online ordering for delivery. Delicious food was delivered accurate, fast, fresh & hot!! Great delivery experience with this restaurant!
259.name: Kellie

260.review: The restaurant is tiny and you’re  sitting right on top of other people. We had dumplings and pad Thai. Dumplings were super soft and fell apart. My husband liked his chicken pad Thai, however my shrimp pad Thai wasn’t all good. Go to Up Thai if you ever on Upper East side. They have much better dumplings and pad Thai.
260.name: Inna Z

261.review: Not a long wait. Friendly servers. The food was great quality with some spice to it - not Thai spicy though - very much tolerable. Good came out to the table at a reasonable amount of time from when we ordered. The Thailand coffee was great! Enjoyed Pure Thai Cookhouse - would return.
261.name: Joshua Augusto

262.review: Great pad thai and spring rolls! Good portion. Cozy location. They have thai beer (Singha). Good service, but I’m still wondering if the gratuity is indeed ‘suggested’
262.name: th V

263.review: Very small and crowded place, very popular and a little too hot inside. The dumplings are to die for. The main dish I ordered was not that exciting, but in all fairness, I wasn't really in the mood for thai, so it could have just be me :)
263.name: bianca iordan

264.review: Amazing Thai restaurant !!!!!!!!!! We came in on a sunday afternoon and were told the wait would be 45 mins. The host was able to get us in less than 30 mins. The interior was unique. The set up gave you the street food feeling experience. Food time was reasonable compared to how busy they were. Food was amazing also. I would recommend the ratchaburi noodles and sukhothai noodle soup. And the service was excellent.
264.name: Thu Nguyen

266.review: Food was simple and yet fantastic to taste.  Apetizer (sea food salad) was just delicious.
266.name: Arijit chattopadhyay

267.review: I hope your customers are lot! But it would be more then more..I am a web designer! I do Google, Bing, Yandex Engine Optimization! I give a guarantee for you will be in first page on google at your city with your web site! You can see my phone on image! First job for trust! Pay later!
267.name: Mustafa Alper Temelkaya

268.review: Unique flavors, always interesting specials. The Thai pop music is fun too. The staff is very friendly as well.
268.name: tom barratt

269.review: Amazing food , authentic and never misses to impress. Place is small so wait time is long.
269.name: T Qayyum

270.review: Cozy, high traffic spot with authentic Thai food.
270.name: Rhonda Mona

271.review: The best Thai in new York.  I hate the wait but in t is truly worth it.
271.name: Steven Silver

272.review: Great food. Very busy in the afternoon but worth the wait.
272.name: Kenice

273.review:
Hidden gem in Hell’s Kitchen. It’s one of the best thaï restaurant I’ve ever been. It’s cute, small, authentic and the staff is so nice ! 
Food is great and not expensive at all. Great atmosphere for a late diner or a date. 

Food : *****
Atmosphere : ****
Service : *****
Price : **

- : no reservations, always a line-up
+ : very good prices, perfect for a late diner
273.name: Viriane Pes

274.review: In an area full of respectable Thai food, this place stands out both for quality and creativity. Really like the music they play also.
274.name: Albert Freeman

275.review: Loved this place! Big portions of really good food. My plate was pretty spicy. Everything was priced well. I would recommend it.
275.name: Maranda Nielson

276.review: Food here tastes like real Thai food and their service is fast.
276.name: Servando So Yong Silva Sohn

278.review: There’s a very good reason why this place is so highly rated. Once I️ sat to order I️ felt instantly transported to another country, totally didn’t feel like nyc(thank God)The service is AMAZING, and the food??? Good lord, it was incredible!!!! I️ want to return, in fact I️ will return. This place has earned my business and a stellar review!
278.name: Ingrid Nunez

279.review: Pure Thai was good so we decided to take a walk and we weren't disappointed! It is pretty small so if you want to sit in then you may have to wait a while, but luckily it was fairly quiet at the time we went. We then ordered a takeaway the next day and it was just as delicious! Try the coconut milk as well, it's really tasty!
279.name: Jack Azure

280.review: Very good Thai food & great service.
280.name: Yogev Sembira

281.review: Delicious food, courteous staff. Small restaurant with big flavors and quality food.
281.name: Alex Conner

282.review: Amazing food, small authentic location. Faultless
282.name: Eric Mills

283.review: It's really small, but really, really good.  Very authentic with GREAT service.
283.name: Terry Rivers

284.review: One of my favorite Thai places in NYC, and this is one of the top Thai restaurants in Hell’s Kitchen. Their seafood noodles and their duck soup noodles are both very good. They also make fantastic pad thai, and the appetizer ribs are a must try. The wait is almost always more than one hour however, so I would recommend paying a visit to this place early for lunch or early/late for dinner.
284.name: Youer Shao

285.review:
Good small cozy place to eat.
I liked music here.

Ambience : 3
Food : 5
Value for money : 4
Service : 4

Need more options for vegetarians
285.name: prashant Nidgunde

286.review: Authentic Thai. Atmosphere like streets of Bangkok
286.name: Zach Thomas

288.review:
Love coming here and it has amazing, tasty food ! Got there a half hour before opening
And there was a line before it even opened. The entire place filled up within 5 mins of opening. The mango sticky rice is amazing.
288.name: Mary Ashmore

289.review: Extra ordinary Thai restaurant in extra ordinary city! The interior decor is very nice and unique, and the dishes served are hearty and delicious. The wait line (I heard) could be quite long, so you might want to call them in advance. Also, the place is very nice and cute, but pretty small, so might not be an ideal location to meet for a larger group of people.
289.name: Won C.

290.review: Had a lovely pad Thai and spring rolls! The ambiance and music are super authentic, the flavors were spot on, and service was fast!
290.name: Alex Aronovich

291.review: Served me fast, filled me up for less than $20 (all included), might be my new go-to thai place
291.name: Ben Lerner

292.review: Bad place, the food was terrible
292.name: Tania Pereira

294.review: Great atmosphere, great food, and great service! It does feel like you're eat Thai Street food. Food comes out so hot. You know they cook that stuff fresh!
294.name: Randy Singh

295.review: One of my favorite Thai spots in NYC.
295.name: Robert Jantz

296.review: Been here a few times and it is always busy. Be prepared to wait if you come at prime time. They do not take reservations. Everything we've ordered we've been happy with. All the food is very tasty and fresh-tasting. Ambiance is a little cramped but overall really nice.
296.name: John Butterfield

297.review:
Pad thai excellent food and fresh 
Good music 
Staff friendly and helpful. 
😋😋😋      delicious 😋
297.name: Araba d

298.review: Good food but the wait was exceptionally long (45 min). The chicken was lightly seasoned most of the flavoring came from the sauce for dipping. The vegetable dumplings were good but it has a lot of peanuts in it!
298.name: Chandra Ade-Browne

299.review: Friendly service,  tasty food and reasonable pricing
299.name: H.-P. Simon

300.review: Tasty Thai fare within walking distance to Broadway theaters. Always affordable, and a nice casual spot. It is rather cozy inside, but plenty of hooks for coats.
300.name: Kathryn Hagen

301.review: Best Thai food ever. Really really delicious. The restaurant is small so you may have to wait and/or sit with strangers but it is so worth it. Their papaya salad and turmeric beef are my personal favorites!
301.name: Gregory J

302.review: Of all the Thai restaurants that I have been to in New York City, Boston, and Washington D.C., this restaurant provided me with the food that reminded me the most of Thailand. I had the beef noodle soup (which was similar to the canal beef noodle soup in Bangkok) and the raw crab spicy green papaya salad. The spicy-ness intensity is clearly not as extreme as Thailand, but for two hours I ate listening to Thai pop songs, I really felt as if I might be sitting in Thailand again. The restaurant also offers a nice pumpkin sticky rice that comes in a large bamboo leaf. Expect a wait.
302.name: Lena Wu

303.review:
Was recommended a dish by my server: fried chicken over rice with hot and sweet sauce. It was pretty good.
Their chives pancakes were great! Good value for money!
303.name: Sambhavi Vempati

304.review: Good Thai food for westerners but not for thai people
304.name: Pacharadanai Colmart

306.review: Lovely cosy atmosphere, delicious noodles - make sure you get the homemade ones with pork and crab. Truly yum!
306.name: Alexander Dousie

307.review: If you are looking for authentic Thai food you need to visit this place. It's a small cute restaurant, it always has a waiting, but the food is Definitely worth the wait. Loved it
307.name: Pooja Bandekar

308.review: This is a hidden gem. It's always busy, they don't take reservations but everyone always waits the 45 minutes or so to get seated. The restaurant itself is pretty much a hall way, everyone is crammed together inside this little place. The food is amazing! Get the vegetable dumplings and you won't be disappointed!
308.name: Ahmed El-Mesiri

309.review: Very good thaï good , excellent pad Thaï , not to expensive. Very good place
309.name: raphael de neeff

310.review: They dont have tomyam soup but they have the best noodle, chicken wings, satay, and chicken/pork basil🙌
310.name: bv Santy

311.review: My favorite Thai place, always come for their chicken wings, pad ki mao. This is a very small place so wait is pretty bad, always had to wait like over 30 mins.
311.name: Chuchu Zhan

312.review: Delicious food, very friendly personnel, would go there again! Thank you!
312.name: Marcel Geltman

313.review: Excellent, tasty food, and great service.
313.name: Randolph Hoppe

314.review: Awesome SF foodie spot! I highly recommend the fresh oysters, the best I've had in the city! There's a great patio (that has heat lamps because this is SF after all) that you can hang out on and take your time enjoying the amazing experience! There's a great low-key bar in the back with limited seating, but usually turns over pretty quickly. The food is always excellent as is the service. Make reservations just incase.
314.name: lin lee

315.review: Do not go here. I was there and though the food was not that bad, it was not athentic Thai and I know you must. Adapt to the local culture so I accept the food and say it was ok but when they brought the bill they did not gave you much of a choice of what to tip...the  amounts predetermined for you. And they were all above ten percent... certainly not fair and not legal.
315.name: Chian-Tilung Abraham

317.review: Mild = very spicy, food was decent, great service
317.name: Akshay Awasthi

318.review: Really tasty almost-authentic Thai - it's authentic in style but softened for the new world wankers. Great friendly service. Authentic Asian beer! I love the beef salad - get it spicy cos it's really not that spicy.
318.name: Rowan Pritchard

320.review: Great food, friendly staff and amazing atmosphere! Definitely recommend this place. Thanks!
320.name: Yaroslav Pogrebnyak

323.review: Fantastic Thai food, definitely ranked among the better Thai restaurants I've been to. Catered well to my tastes, and offers good prices despite it's fantastic location.
323.name: Jacob Lundy

325.review: My favorite Thai restaurant in NYC. Great food, great price, great staff. Perfect proximity to the theater district for dinner before a broadway show. Very efficient at handling wait time. Never have to wait more than 30 minutes to get a table on a Friday/Saturday night
325.name: Peter Gibbs

326.review: If you're in New York City, you can get the true feel of a Thailand cookhouse without having to leave 9th Avenue. Stepping into Pure Thai brings images of the crowded streets of Bangkok, while the smell of the home cooked food and friendly staff make you feel more welcome than a normal New York restaurant. We were seated right away by a friendly waitress who took our drinks as soon as we sat down. The Pure Thai Iced Tea with Jasmine and Mint is unbelievable. When ordering a starter, you can't beat the baby back ribs that fell right off the bone. While there are dozens of unique Thai dishes on the menu, as well as daily specials, the standard Pad Thai (with chicken and extra peanut sauce) was the best I've had in the city. With a price at around $25 per person, it is on the cheaper end of a Midtown restaurant. I would recommend Pure Thai for a first date, or even a pre-theatre meal. I will certainly be back.
326.name: Torrey Tolikver

327.review: The food was super fresh and Pad Thai was no where to be found. Highly recommend.
