327.name: Laura Parnizari

328.review:
Pure Thai is by far the best Thai food in NYC. Creative, authentic, and downright delicious, Pure Thai Cookhouse delivers an explosion of exotic Southeast Asian flavor with phenomenal customer service. 

Whether ordering delivery or dining, I am always satisfied with me experience. The restaurant atmosphere is characterized by authentic Thai decor and music coupled with hard-working, friendly waitstaff. 

Order anything on the menu. You will not be disappointed.
328.name: Kurt Hildebrandt

329.review: Always packed, food always delicious. This is a favorite thai place in Manhattan
329.name: Kareem Alston

330.review:
This was the best Thai food I've ever had. Even with a group of 6, service was incredibly exceptional. They went out of their way to get food out fast, clear plates, refill drinks, and all around just delivery an awesome experience.

It was so tight inside, that it actually felt like we were all inside a small boat, on the water in Thailand itself. The food, and noodles, are off the hook, and the price was an absolute bargain for the quality. Crazy good!
330.name: Spencer Boerup

331.review: Best Thai food! They have pretty interesting dishes like vermicelli noodles with curry and vegetables. Dishes are easily substituted, like vegetables instead of pork, so it's a good place for vegetarians.
331.name: Charlie Petty

332.review: Exactly what I was looking for. Wanted a unique, non-toursty, delicious southeast Asian spot. This place did not disappoint. "Dry"rice noodles with duck, saki (from a can, Highly recommend) and service were all great. I was there on a Thursday  (slightly busy) and by myself so I can't attest to the wait. Will return for sure.
332.name: Joseph Patton

333.review:
Good tasting food. But portion is a bit too small. 

The Thai tea was great. Chicken satay was good too but only 4 pieces for 8 bucks. The Pure Thai noodle was delicious but I wish there was more noodle in it. Fried rice was a bit lighter (less salty) but portion was just nice for this one.
333.name: Justin Lin

334.review: I had the jungle chicken curry it was amazing the tofu was pretty good roo
334.name: Chris Winger

335.review: Mm best Thai food! They have pretty interesting dishes like vermicelli noodles with curry and vegetables. Dishes are easily substituted, like vegetables instead of pork, so it's a good place for vegetarians.
335.name: Michelle Miron

337.review: Yummy: pea shoots with garlic oyster sauce and minced pork (not on menu) BUT crispy duck was too crispy (dry and tough to chew) for me. Had to go early bird ;)
337.name: byulaa yoo

338.review: Delicious, different, great atmosphere, never been to Thailand, but sure seems like the real thing.
338.name: Lucia Perfetti Clark

339.review: De. Lish. Us.  Holy Basil Chicken?  I miss it soo much. I would move back to NYC just for that!
339.name: Crisp Carlin

340.review: Damn good Thai food. Had the pad see Ew and it was great, though I thought it was a tad bit dry, but I'm also being too picky probably. However, it was $14 with beef. Portions are pretty big too! Highly recommend it!
340.name: Alishah Jamal

342.review: I like this place for tasty Thai food in Hell's kitchen. They make very flavorful soups. Today, I had the Pork Noodle soup with flat wide rice noodles. It came with lots of crispy pork rinds on top and slices of roast pork. I love the flavor bursts from the dried shrimp and the peanuts. The soup was just a little sweet for me. I never had a bad dish here.
342.name: Jackie Gordon Singing Chef

343.review:
Really wonderful curry puffs. I'm undone. Soft, flaky and just ever-so-tasty. 
The actual duck noodle soup was good, not great. The broth was a little too sweet and didn't have the depth of flavor I was expecting, though the noodles were good.
The ratchaburi crab, similarly, didn't have the complexity I was looking for. It was a light, spicy, crab-deficient dish. Hoping to find better noodles, too, in the future.
343.name: R Wu

344.review:
[sung to the tune 100% Pure Love by Crystal Waters]

It's 12 past midnight, don't close your eyes
Your soup is half alive, and I'll be by your side
I've come to eat my share, add spice if you dare
Just be aware, that you'll have to share

I want your crab, I want it tonight
I'm taking your noodles, so don't you fight
I'll be your answer, I'll be your wish
You'll be my fantasy, my favorite dish

From the back to the middle and around again
I'm gonna eat there til the end
100% Pure Thai

From the back to the middle and around again
I'm gonna eat there til the end
100% Pure Thai
344.name: Chris Maliwat

345.review: Very small and long wait but delicious food. The soup noodles and dumplings were good. Staff is friendly but expect to be bumped into multiple times while eating.
345.name: Naz M.

346.review: Tiny building, but great food and good prices.
346.name: Tristan Anderson

347.review: The best thai food I had in a while. Place is always packed although we were seated last. We waited 1/2 hour for our table at 10:30 pm. The food came 5 minutes after we ordered, and it was authentically delicious. Staff is very friendly too
347.name: Bill Sayagh

348.review: You've got to try the Mango Rice dessert!! The Thai Iced Tea was unique and delicious too. Friendly staff, quick service, incredible Wok and Pad Thai dishes. Amazing experience
348.name: Melissa Rohwer

349.review: We got there at the beginning of the dinner rush. We put our name on a waiting list and we told that we would be sent a text when our table was ready. This allowed us to go and get a drink at another bar and explore the area a bit before. Once we took our seat service was quick and the food was delicious. I had the rachimbura crab and dry pork noodles and my husband had pad Thai. Both were excellent. The only negative was that there was only one single-stall bathroom which while spacious and clean, did cause a fairly lengthy wait. This may be a common place thing for restaurants in New York... I haven't been to enough to be able to say.
349.name: Virginia Fraser

350.review: The most amazinh Thai Food! The smell of the soup is stuck in my mind.
350.name: Ju Ferraz

351.review: Super yummy but not blow-your-mind good like I was expecting based on others reviews. Very "cozy".
351.name: Carly Jordan

352.review: Very very tasty and authentic Thai food. Warning: the food is very spicy
352.name: Calum McKerlie

356.review: Tiny shop but food is great
356.name: Raul Diamante

357.review:
We two arrived about 9pm. Pure Thai is a typical NYC restaurant which would fit in a 60-foot x 12-foot trailer: cramped. But the place was full with a couple parties in front us. 15 minutes later  we were seated, having used the time to look at the menu. We were seated at a table with some other guests, but they were quite friendly. We selected two appetizers and two different dinners. All the food was absolutely delicious, spicy and plenty of flavor. The service was flawless, quick, friendly and attentive. 
 Some of the other reviews here have criticized the service or the food - I can't help but wonder if they are reviewing the correct restaurant or bogus, because our experience was that Pure Thai was the most enjoyable meal of our trip to NYC and possibly the best Thai we've eaten anywhere. The prices seemed fairly reasonable, the food was great and the people quite friendly. I'll return there again, given the chance, on my next trip to NYC for sure.
357.name: Elf Wyatt

358.review: Was good. Not great.  One entree came out before appetizers and then my entree was Luke warm.  Flavors were also good, not great.  It’s worth visiting, but not a destination.
358.name: R Vincik

359.review: The food was very good at a great price; very friendly atmosphere. I highly recommend tge dumplings.
359.name: pecado cinematográfico

360.review: The best Thai in NYC. Everthying I ate was amazing, authentic pad thai. Plus they have Singha beer
360.name: Jessica Zarkin Notni

361.review: Flavorful dishes and upbeat, attentive staff. A must visit.
361.name: Kelly Lickfield

362.review: Very small and tight, but oh soooo delicious
362.name: Terry Rivers

363.review: Love Pure Thai one of my top Thai that I ever tried during vacation!
363.name: Chinh David Nguyen

364.review: Lots to wait. Food is decent. I don’t think it’s authentic but good food.
364.name: Lisa Kim

365.review:
After waiting 45 minutes on a Sunday night, we sat down and ordered everything that seemed vegetarian on the menu only to find out that only one thing, the steamed vegetable dumplings, were actually completely vegetarian. Everything else was cooked with oyster sauce. I'd say it's definitely not vegetarian friendly.

P.S. The dumplings were delicious!
365.name: Andrew Kofink

366.review: Usually a 20m wait. Best Pad Thai I ever had (That's a staple you can judge all Thai places!) Food is authentic and so is the ambiance!
366.name: Anj Lupan

367.review: I love this place. Great Thai food, though you often need to wait for a table.
367.name: Ross Cluver

368.review: No wonder this is a high rated Thai restaurant! The jungle curry friend rice is the BEST Thai dishes that I have ever eaten! If I ever go to New York again, I will definitely go to this restaurant! I will definitely recommend this place to everyone who likes Thai food or spicy food. I would love to try their other dishes as well next time :D
368.name: Evanes Sze

370.review: Very small place and always busy but worth the wait. Their house roasted pork was great, their pad see ew had the perfect balance, and the service was excellent.
370.name: Xavier O

371.review: Ordered the shrimp pad Thai with extra shrimp, spice level spicy.  It was excellent.  I'll have to order it at least one more time before I leave New York.  Some of the best I've ever tasted, except the dried shrimp they include in the dish.  Next time I'll just have them exclude it.
371.name: BinksBurrell

372.review: Nice restaurant with very good meals.
372.name: Alexandre Kieffer

373.review: Fantastic food at a great value. There is always a wait, but we'll worth it.  The atmosphere is very well conceived.  Don't forget to wash it all down with some sake! You can't go wrong here
373.name: Mitchell Bayne

374.review: The best Thai noodles in NYC , 5 stars for this place
374.name: Panchita Paphaneuaphan

375.review: Cool small place with atmopshere. Food and staff was great
375.name: Vince Szebasztián

376.review: Amazing Thai food coconut soup was really good
376.name: vivek vijayan

377.review: Good place and food. Need to improve food rating from B though.  Pad Thai is a little sweet for me hence 3 stars
377.name: Frat Iqbal

378.review: omg so delicious... Best pad thai hands down.
378.name: Jessica Jung

380.review: Simply my favorite Thai restaurant in that part of town (and there are many). The food is authentic. The problem is that it's so busy it's really difficult to get a table, normally the wait is such that we try end up going somewhere else nearby, unfortunately. I'm so happy when we can get a table there, as the food is quite good and spicy. Also, not too pricey. (The one thing I find a bit difficult is the low seating on these little metal chairs, it's hard on my back.)
380.name: Martin Blais

381.review:
We were warned about long wait times so we walked in, made a reservation and were texted when it was available (45-60 mins) which was a great service.

The food was amazing! We ordered chicken Pad Thai and wet hand-made made noodles with crab and pork. The place is small but the service was quick and attentive. Be warned you'll be sitting close to other patrons, if this bothers you.
381.name: Cynthia C

382.review: Couldn't even eat there. I went here with some friends and when we arrived, there was no line or hostess so we sat ourselves down at the seats right by the entrance (no worker mentioned anything to us). When the hostess comes to tell us that the seats were reserved, she was quite rude to us explaining how we couldn't just sit down. I'm sorry, but with no sign saying "wait to be seated" or a hostess to greet us or even a podium, I don't really think it was much of a stretch to assume that we could seat ourselves. The wait time ended up being well over an hour, so we just left. I don't really think it's worth coming back another day because of the service (or lack thereof).
382.name: Jade Maak

383.review: One of our tour guides recommended this place and we were glad that we took his advice.  Upgrade to the hand made noodles while you there.  Service was excellent and the food was great!
383.name: Steve Tarpley

384.review: Very very good Thai food! Get in early to beat the rush!
384.name: Eddie Liao

385.review: Food was great.  The vegetable dumplings were a real treat.  Small place but very quaint.  Worth a visit
385.name: Jan Ackerman

386.review: Amazing food but they lack options for beverages. The Thai coffee and tea were too sweet and they couldn't make it less sweet. Didn't particularly like the Singha beer either
386.name: Yogesh Kauntia

387.review: Had a table right away, even as a group of 5. Food was amazing. Definitely would go again
387.name: Emma Khoury

388.review: Great place for drunken noodles and the wok basil chicken and turmeric beef are really good. They have a daily rotation of appetizer and mains specials.
388.name: Ammar Khalid

389.review: Highly recommend their Thai iced coffee and phad Thai. They don't take reservations and are quite popular so be prepared to wait especially on busy nights. They have some indoor waiting space.
389.name: Krushna Ranaware

390.review: Some of the best Thai in all of NYC
390.name: Stephen Gray

391.review: Great tasting authentic thai food. Yum yum would recommend. Had duck noodles and paf seew for dinner. Super good!
391.name: Wynd

392.review: Amazing food and a cozy atmosphere
392.name: Braden Arnold

394.review: Good thai food. Usually stick to the Pad Thai, but my friends really love the Pad See Ew (I think that's how you spell that)
394.name: Andrew Timosca

395.review: I'd give 6 stars if I could.
395.name: Tiffany Spaulding

396.review: food great. line long but worth it. love the spice!
396.name: Robert Weisenfeld

397.review: My favourite Thai place in the city! I grew up in Malaysia and travelled to Thailand often, trust me when I say the food here is as authentic as you'll ever get in NYC. The place itself is not very big, and there is ALWAYS a wait, unless you come at some random hour like 3pm. I love all their noodle dishes and make sure you look at the board for their specials!
397.name: Jo-Anne Loh

398.review: Great food! If you're into Thai cuisine, you should definitely check it out. Hard to seat though, long lines :( hence a 4 star
398.name: Laura Garcia

399.review: One of the best places to eat good food and great service
399.name: שרון דוידוב

400.review: Decent food. Below average service. They argued with us when we did not pay for regular tip. Wouldn't go again.
400.name: Mani Mahal

401.review: Delicious fried rice and noodles, love the curry dumplings sooo much.  And also recommended the pumpkin desert, although the rice is a little bit too sweet.
401.name: 阿丝Serena

402.review: It is not easy to find a great reason to go eat in Hells Kitchen. That said, this may be the second I have ever found! Very simple and yet a cut above.
402.name: Max Brawer

404.review: Really attentive and great staff, food was amazing and reasonably priced.
404.name: Diana Masters

405.review: Fantastic food in a cozy setting. Waiters were very attentive, which helped make the table not feel so cramped.
405.name: Chauncey Lee

406.review: Great place, feels like you're in small shack in thailand. Food was great and good service. We had lunch here and tried the calamari and chicken.
406.name: Ivo Dukic

407.review: Say nothing just eat. One of the best Thai food to eat in Manhattan. Loved it
407.name: BB Tripathi

408.review: Great food! It fills up fast and they won't seat you until your party is all there--so plan accordingly.  Super casual.
408.name: Karen Rinehart

409.review: Aaaaaamazing. I got a chicken basil wok dish and it was out of this world. Friendly staff. Really cool encirclement.
409.name: Hunter Nottingham

410.review: Great place, affordable, amazing food. Come out your name on the list. The small wait is worth it. If you're looking for a good place to eat without killing your budget this is worth the visit.
410.name: Brooke Green

412.review: A literal hole in the wall that's easy to miss if you're not looking carefully. I came in right before closing and they had no problems accommodating me.  I had the pad see ew and the satay.  Both were outstanding.  Great dinner place and after theater dining.
412.name: John Houser

413.review: You got to go here. One of my best Thai places in the city.
413.name: Ernest Kruah

414.review: Came here to tried their pad Thai  and a bit disappointed. It taste much more sweeter than the pad Thai I usually have, and I have to put so much spicy sauce in it to cover the sweetness. But I like their environment a lot, all the decoration and vibe...Don't think I'm coming back after this
414.name: Yiming Yang

415.review: Cute little place with good food , quick service , and authentic music .
415.name: Julia Zorko

417.review: This place is amazing.had to be right at 12 noon otherwise you will miss the stop.if you are here by 12.05 get ready to wait for atleast 30 min.super popular restaurant around area and the food was amazing.
417.name: Thushara Dassanayake

418.review: I love Thai food. It was acceptable, but not really good.
418.name: Natasha Novitskaia

419.review: I love it here. The Pad Kee Moa never disappoints. Vegetable dumplings and the beef buns are great to order as well. Expect a wait...always. The place is small and cozy. Oh, and get some Funaguchi sake in a can!
419.name: Joey Jordano

420.review: The food was excellent. The seating area was small, but we didn't have a wait. The food came quickly and was reasonably priced for downtown NYC. The staff was also very friendly and attentive.
420.name: Shelly Beard

421.review: Well worth the wait!  The best Thai food that I have ever had.  It's a tight squeeze, but the service is great!   The meal was great quality at a fair price.
421.name: Julie Falther

422.review: Exceptional food in a very narrow space. My husbands’s instinct was to leave; so glad we stayed.
422.name: Diane Withiam

423.review: Creative, tasty food! Had the curry puffs and the basil minced chicken. Both were very tasty! Careful: the place is tiny, so if you're not by yourself, expect a wait.
423.name: Julio Gerchman

424.review: I am still craving the noodles I had from this place. I eat a lot of Thai food: this was the very best. I wish I lived here, I would eat here every day.
424.name: Lisa Banks

425.review: Closet of a restaurant situated in a neighborhood with a few solid Asian food options. Loved the steamed beef buns and the spicy pork noodle soup. Would happily stop by again. Be prepared for a wait!
425.name: Florian Koenigsberger

426.review: Best Thai food in New York City. Recommend Pad Kee Mao and beef salad but EVERY SINGLE DISH is delicious.
426.name: Chris Jayme

427.review: The wait time is pretty long here but it is well worth the wait. One of the best Thai place in the area with decent price. I always have to get their curry chicken puff! They are not crazy oily like the make it in other places, the stuffing is amazing, and the dipping sauce they give you completes it all!
427.name: Young Cho

428.review: Waiter was very nice and the food tasted amazing. The sticky rice served with pumpkin was amazing.
428.name: Jacqueline Arisumi

429.review: The food here is delicious! I ordered the vegetable dumplings and pad see ewe with beef and I completely cleaned my plate. This is definitely the best Thai food that they offer in the area. The service is friendly and quick, too. It's become my go-to Thai place.
429.name: Jaclyn Golda-Luk

430.review: This food was soooo good! Would go out of our way to go back. It was busy,but the people were friendly. Food was reasonably priced. I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu. Totally check it out, great lunch spot!
430.name: Amanda Lavertu

431.review: Excellent!!! Small place but excelent food and service!!
431.name: Flora Aviram

432.review: Cool interior, I wasn't impressed by the food though :/
432.name: Kyle Stewart

433.review: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in Hell's Kitchen out of the many that are there.  The dishes are actually spicy and pretty authentic.  My favorite dishes are the Ratchaburi crab and pork dry noodles and the papaya salad with salted blue crab.  For the dry noodles, add the pork crackling! It will be worth it.  The place is small so I couldn't bring big groups there.
433.name: Julie Xiao

434.review: Authentic,  delicious, and spicy,  just the way Thai food should be.  Went here while in NYC for business and was blown away.  Very crowded for dinner (for good reason). We had a party of 4 and had a 20 minute wait but boy was it worth it. Don't miss the beef Bao buns!
434.name: Dave Kyle

435.review: Great food. Really brings me back to traveling in Thailand - authentic.
435.name: Karen Ee

436.review: Excellent place. Thai food here is very genuine and the spot is nice! Recommended!
436.name: Alex F. Lazo

437.review: Very tasty food. Authentic flavours that pack a Thai punch!
437.name: Alex

438.review: Wanting to go here on a Friday evening for Dinner, but as expected, the place is full and the wait is 1 hour+. So did a take away instead and it was quite good, the food was prepared within 15 minutes and was very very tasty. Not exceptional but really authentic
438.name: Kathryn Rogers

439.review: I love Thai food and the spicy shrimp is great
439.name: Luna Sandovar

440.review: The dry crab noodles are one of my favorite noodles to eat. Everyone I know who’ve tried it...loves it.
440.name: Angie Nguyen

441.review: Worth waiting for it, amazing Thai food in Manhattan. Service and atmosphere are both great as well, will come back for sure !
441.name: Clément Bourgeois

443.review: Get there early.   We had a 2:00 show so got in line for the 12pm opening.  We'll decorated for such a small place. Seats are like stools, no backs.  We had the dumplings, papaya salad and wok chili tumeric with beef.  Everything was flavorful and delicious.  Service was courtiers and pretty quick.  We did get out by 1pm so plenty of time to spare but would not have made it if we missed first seating.  Would definately go back again.
443.name: Darlene Garrison

444.review: Authentic Thai in a tiny place. We tried 4 dishes and all were great. The wait on Friday night was long though, call ahead.
444.name: Vlad Sobol

446.review: The food was very tasty and tastes authentic. The restaurant is very cozy. If coming in a group larger than 4 be prepared to wait awhile.
446.name: Audrey Wong

447.review: I love noodles and Pure has a good collection of authentic noodles. It's probably the size of a real cookhouse in Thailand so the wait could be a bit for dinner but the spicy seafood soup is delicious. It's also cool to watch them cook up the noodle dishes right near the front of the restaurant.
447.name: Rex Pham

448.review: If you want to experience authentic Thai, this is the place to be. Almost all dishes were good. I especially liked the dumplings. It gets really crowded in the evening, and expect to wait for a couple hours if you do not have reservations.
448.name: Raymond Kim

449.review: Very small place with awesome thai food. Everything is super tasty and they have some dishes different than the typical thai restaurant. Service is good too. The only thing that didn't like (and is just a minor thing) is having to eat in a stool (they just have one table with actual chairs). Other than that is a really great choice.
449.name: Antonio Yague

450.review: Very small place,,BUT, the food was OUTSTANDING!! My Brother was visiting, he's lived in Korea for many years and has been to Thailand,,, and he actually LOVED THIS PLACE!! We're DEFINITELY going back!
450.name: Theresa

452.review:
Ka Pao Kai was a little bit strong taste but everything was delicious!!!
I can’t wait to go again:)
452.name: Mary

453.review: Had a good time here. Warning though - the wait for a table might be over an hour on a weekday after work. Because this place does not take reservations you cannot avoid the wait, which can be annoying. I did enjoy the food, however.
453.name: Anda Totoreanu

454.review: Food good, Quality control not good.  Ordered numerous times takeout from this place. TODAY, June 30, my rice contained an "extra".  A triangle piece of paper towel, maybe the corner if the rice bag, I don't know what this is. HOW do you not notice when pouring rice into the rice cooker?  HOW do you not notice when cooking, I don't know. Nasty.
454.name: Robert K. Chin

455.review: No soap in bathroom?????  Sign says employees must wash hands really????? Not impressed with food or quality. I have had much better. Wonder who is writing the reviews?
455.name: Sparkers Smith

456.review: One of my favorite Thai places in the city, consistently good and always delicious!  They can make it spicy and their specials are usually excellent.
456.name: Vishal Merani

457.review: Definitely one of my favorite spots but the poor sitting room situation is mega-annoying.
457.name: Daniel L

458.review: We were walking by the streets of NY and saw this place. It was quite busy, waited for a little bit and was not disappointed. Food was awesome, definitely a place to visit if you are around NY
458.name: cabadin karl

459.review: One of best Thai in NYC...
459.name: Adrien Briand

460.review: Food was good and flavorful. They don't sweeten their foods that many other Thai restaurants do. The reason I gave it 3 stars is because my wife is vegetarian and doesn't even eat fish which means no fish sauce. She wanted the papaya salad and they stated they add the sauce afterwards but she asked them not to include that part but they wouldn't oblige. They never explained why they couldn't do it but just refused.
460.name: Sanjay Dave

461.review: Went with family and we all enjoyed the food. Was my mothers first time eating Thai and the staff were very friendly to steer her with a recommendation. I had Pad Thai Shrimp and everyone agreed it was the best plate. For Appetizer we had dumplings and they were great.
461.name: Juan C

462.review: Well-priced, lightning-quick service, and fresh ingredients.  Always worth the typical wait time. Probably the best Thai I've had in NYC.  Food could be spicier.
462.name: Tom Montgomery

463.review: One of my favorite Thai places.  The Thai tea is perfect.  Noodles scrumptious and the specials are always a delight.
463.name: Ada

464.review: My favorite Thai place in the city. Quick food, good portions, friendly staff.
464.name: Edward Lee

465.review: Unbelievable Thai food. If I could eat here everyday I would. This is eating at its best. Almost a primal experience.
465.name: John Tessieri

466.review: Amazing, very authentic Thai food and the best Thai iced tea!
466.name: Meredith Macdonald

467.review: Tasty and delicious food with a very adequate price. To visit again!
467.name: Ana Azevedo

468.review: Good Thai food and dessert (pumpkin custard). Advertised BYOB on one of the lists on Google maps but was not the case so awkwardly had beers with us that we could not drink.
468.name: Seth Nelson

470.review: This place is absolutely delicious, and it offers a number of dishes you would not find at your average Thai restaurant in NYC.  There isn't a dish I've had that wasn't fantastic.  Be sure to check the specials before you order as they often have entrees that are very different from what is regularly featured.  Be warned that when they ask if you want your food "spicy," they mean it.
470.name: Badr Albanna

471.review: Really good food. Almost always crowded since its really small. Most times, I put my name and then get a drink at a bar close by. Would not suggest getting there super hungry
471.name: ipsita kumar

472.review: Authentic Thai in a neighborhood full of ok but not fantastic Thai places. Lots of fish sauce, smell isn't for everyone but damn it tastes good and is used liberally like that in the food I had when traveling in Thailand. Green papaya salad is awesome, packed a punch. *Don't order "spicy" unless you really want to be blown away.
472.name: Kevin Meenan

473.review: Very very tiny restaurant. Hardly any room to sit. But excellent food!
473.name: Beck JJ

474.review: Not as good as it use to be the menu has changed
474.name: Karen Bernardino

475.review: Really great service and wonderful environment. Nice food portions and excellent flavors and taste. You will be glad you came.
475.name: Elizabeth Humphries

477.review: We had to wait for like an hour but it was worth it. Fresh thai food and good daily specials.
477.name: Alberto Mayorga Dominguez

478.review: The food is good, but dont know if it lives up to the hype. The wait times are very long unless you can go before the rush hits.
478.name: Annie Cho

479.review:
I loved this place! 

Got the curry puffs to start and they were really good. 

I got the Sukhothai Pork Noodles Soup which was awesome!

Service was excellent, I had a couple of the Thai beers which were great as well.

Everything looked so good here, I was tempted to get more but we were so full by the time we were done.

It is a very small place though so you will probably have to wait. They take your name and number and call you when your table is ready. We just went to the bar next door, so it worked out well for us.
479.name: Malinda LaBar

480.review: Often a queue to get a table but worth the wait for the food
480.name: Jonny Dow

481.review: I have eaten in Pure Thai many times! It is by far the best Thai restaurant in the mid town area. Don't be put off by the wait for a table as the food is well worth it! The only bit of advice I would give is that this is not a restaurant where you can have a leisurely meal and you can sometimes feel a little rushed but all in all a great restaurant and it is reasonably priced.
481.name: Z J

483.review: Their Pad Thai is fantastic and there are always fun specials so do ask for those! Always a short wait as it is so popular but they manage this well and we always find it well worth the wait.
483.name: Angelika Rauh

484.review: Small place but the food is excellent. I had the carb and pork dry noodle.
484.name: sam li

485.review: Food was really fresh and tasty and very spicy (as ordered) vibe was fun and hip
485.name: Kelsie Davies

486.review: Had sukhothai egg noodle & thai milk tea 👍   so good I finished everything! Very polite and friendly staffs. Will definitely come back here next time i'm in nyc
486.name: piyanun pornphonwat

487.review: Great food poor service. Always ask for change when you pay with cash.
487.name: tub63010

488.review: One of the most popular thai places currently in Hell's Kitchen. A small restaurant with tight seating and usually a wait. The food itself was pretty good but didn't live up to the expectations from other reviews. The seafood pad thai was above average but not great.
488.name: Chris Miao

490.review: Truly amazing Thai food... The special was wonderful
490.name: Tom Bell

491.review: Tight space, long wait..BUT..the food quality was definitely worth it.  Would recommend going here if you make a reservation.  If you want a quick bite you might want to go during "off peak" hours.
491.name: Dencil Smith

492.review: Super fast service, fresh food, uncomfortable seats but worth the pain for the great food. A little on the pricey side for what it is also.
492.name: Julie Arora

493.review: It’s a cool little place, cosy seating and a small but excellent menu.
493.name: Justin Mckie

494.review: Authentic Thai Cuisine with authentic Thai experience. Definitely recommend!
494.name: Pat V

495.review: Amazing place food was incredible. Highly recommend.
495.name: Laura Mason

496.review: awesome spot for thai. my favorite in the city.
496.name: Ambry Kinnel

497.review: Great food. Great price. Will definitely eat here again.
497.name: Mohsin Saber

498.review: The wait can be a bit long, but well worth it. The food is superb, very authentic. Beware, beware, beware, the spice levels of the food are serious, this place does not hold back on the spice.  This is not your run of the mill type of heat.
498.name: K Jay

499.review: An awesome spot with great food. There's a catch though: prepare to wait at least 30 min to seat. But, without a doubt, it's worth the wait.
499.name: Nuno Lapa

500.review: DELICIOUS! My friend and I walked here after a performance at Lincoln Center and it was a GREAT find!! The pad see ewe was delicious. And the Thai Iced Tea? I don't think I've had it better! My friend had the shrimp pad thai which was also super delicious! It's a smaller place and they seat you with other people at bigger tables which is actually kind of cool. But the ambiance is great and the staff is super nice, definitely coming back here again!
500.name: Tanya Barrios

502.review:
Wow! Really impressed with this little thai restaurant. We came on a Sunday night at 8pm and it was packed!! The wait was 1.5hrs, so we decided to get it to go and eat at home. Not a bad idea! (The food only took 15min to prepare).

The pork and egg crab noodle was a really nice dish to start with especially if you pour in the sauce it comes with so it gives it that little sour taste. Really opens up your appetite. 

The curry puffs were surprisingly yummy! I was expecting it to be super dry and since its take out for the puff part to not be very good anymore. But the puff was holding up really well! Very fluffy and not dry at all. 

The crab fried rice was amazing! (We ended up having some left over and I heated it up in the microwave the next morning and still tasted superb). I'd recommend adding some chili flakes they give you and some lemon if you like it slightly sour. 

The chicken wings were also good but not mind blowing so next time I would skip this one and try something else. 

Affordable and authentic thai.
502.name: Rohenne Lee

503.review: Great little hide out and the food was so tasty. Really speedy service and were very attentive! Highly recommend
503.name: Mariana Mancellos

504.review: Amazing spicy food! Friendly service and nice atmosphere!
504.name: Nikos Krodiras

505.review: Some of the best thai food available, the Nakorn-Patom Duck Noodles Soup was especially notable. The space is tight, but the service is good.
505.name: Martin Decker

506.review: Authentic and delicious meal. The service was great and the staff is very attentive! We will definitely visit again!
506.name: Marivelle Baumgarten

507.review: VERY GOOD FOOD A LITTLE BIT PRICEY BUT FOOD AND SERVICE IS GREAT
507.name: Morris Goldberg

509.review: This is the best Thai food I have had in NYC! Quick and comfortable service
509.name: Steve Bronder

510.review: Nice restaurant and good thail good as if were in Bangkok. Booking is mandatory
510.name: Olivier DUPONT

511.review: Very nice place, really friendly and helpful staff and most of all delicious food. A visit in Pure Thai Cookhouse has strengthen my belief that thai cousine is the best in the world!
511.name: Katarzyna Świątkiewicz

512.review: Coming back from watching a broadway show, we came across this place and decided to give it a try. It was delicious! We got pad see ew and green papaya salad. Very good, and waiters were very attentive. The place is super tiny and a bit crowded, but it had a very lively atmosphere, so I didn't mind it.
512.name: Nathan Chan

513.review:
Favorite Thai spot in the city. Ratchaburi Crab & Pork Dry Noodles
are my main squeeze.
513.name: Adrian Mojica

514.review: Awesome Thai place in Hells Kitchen. Food is nice and spicy like real Thai food unlike RoomService or other so called "Thai" restaurants I've tried in the area. Only downside is that it's a tiny place and is usually packed.
514.name: Stephen DeGuglielmo

515.review: Good food. I liked the experience. Wait time was a little long but otherwise good.
515.name: Mirah Wilson

516.review: Great Thai food. Small hole in the place but very good food. The Staffs are friendly and the price is just right.
516.name: Felix

517.review:
This place has a smaller menu than most of the other thai places in the area... and that's a good thing!

Food:
Favorite is the Ratchaburi Crab & Pork Dry Noodle. It's not spicy at all, but it packs a ton of flavor! They have a few other dishes, but just order this and you won't regret it.
They also have a board with daily specials, this time they had some shrimp/chicken dumplings, pretty good.

Service:
The wait can be long, but they will take your phone number and give you a call. You can also choose to wait on the bench inside, but keep in mind it's a tight space. The servers are very attentive and quick.
517.name: Hansel B.

518.review:
Just arrived in NY & already got Burger.
Looking for spicy stuff now & Pure Thai is the REAL thing ... tried severally plates and simply awesome !!!!
518.name: Manu Prete

519.review: Really authentic good food! Also the takeaway is good
519.name: Maarten - Alexander Jongepier

520.review: Ok food,  poor atmosphere, really bad music choices.
520.name: Ceris

522.review: This little Thai joint is one of the best Thai's in the city!  If only they had more seats - there's always a wait.  Beware, when they say spicy, they're not kidding!
522.name: Al Cohen

523.review:
Wow!!!! What a great Thai spot that I wish I would have found this awesome place  months ago.  I was at Herald Square and craving some good Thai food.  Thai food happens to be my favorite type of food.  I hopped on Yelp and read the reviews of several nearby Thai restaurants and the reviews from this spot grabbed me.  

Visited this spot around 2pm on a weekday and it wasn't too busy.  I was seated immediately by a very welcoming staff.  I loved the decor of the space all the way down to the bathroom.  They have bar seating along the wall for parties of one.  I ordered the Wok Basil with Shrimp.  I order Thai Spicy or Thai Hot.  I guess that is the hottest level of spice.  The dished arrived pretty fast and I want to say under 10 minutes.  Immediately first bit I was in love.  It was bursting full of flavor.  I will admit I love spicy food and I love it REALLY REALLY hot.  But I think I might have over step my boundaries.  It was a little more hot than what I thought it would.  So what I recommend get it medium or mild and ask for extra sauce that way you can add a little heat as you go.  Reason I mention this is because there ARE NO RETURNS ON THE FOOD and they will let you know of this as well. 

 They also sell wine and beer at this location as well.  Great restaurant and a new favorite for Thai food when I am in this area.
523.name: Dominek Tubbs

524.review: Best Thai food I've had! Fast service and friendly staff... Only downside is the amount of space for dining, it's really cramped. I would certainly recommend to anyone though.
524.name: Kyle Moore

525.review: So delicious! Went for lunch, quickly seated and food arrived quickly. All items were fantastic, had the pad king kai and my friend had the tumeric beef. Really impressive taste, will definitely be back multiple times!
525.name: Ajul Shah

527.review: Cozy atmosphere, big dishes for a decent price, and really delicious versions of Thai street food. Long waits, just be aware of that.
527.name: Kimberly Worsham

528.review: Authentic atmosphere but food was so so. And they get tips on tax as well,  not just on the food itself.
528.name: Amy Poyung Jung

529.review: Among the many many Thai restaurants dotting this stretch of 9th ave, Pure Thai stands out!  When you walk in there's usually a line, so its best to prepare for a short wait.  The Thai food here is pretty authentic, and trades quality for massive portions, which I prefer.  I recommend the Som Tom salad with the crab! and one of their noodle soups, which very much remind me of the stalls I visited in Bangkok. If you have room try the sticky rice dessert, while I'm not usually a fan, theirs is pretty awesome.
529.name: Fausto Palazzetti

530.review: Tasty noodles. Good texture. Thai iced tea isn't too sweet.
530.name: Karim D

531.review: Strongly recommend to visit there at opening time so that you avoid the long waiting. There are reasons why many people line up.
531.name: Hoisoo Cho

532.review: Great place! Limited seats available and it's popular, so don't mind waiting. Food is excellent.
532.name: Pieter Sijmons

533.review: There Pad Thai is sooooo good!
533.name: Betty Ho

534.review: Almost authentic Thai style noodles. A large menu for such a small space. Be prepare to wait at least 20 mins. Prices a bit high for the type of fare, but there is really no other competition in Manhattan selling this type of food.
534.name: Tim Tsai

535.review: Very weird music mix in a small place. All of the food was good and served quickly.
535.name: Shannon Kauderer

538.review: Awesome authenticThai food! Pad see ew  is always a go-to
538.name: Catherine Wen

539.review: My mouth waters when I think of this place. But it's just too cramped. The tables are tiny and there's never enough room for all the plates. And trust me you'll want to order everything on the menu. Look at the specials board - you can't go wrong ordering from there. Best Thai in Manhattan, imo.
539.name: Rachelle Young

540.review: Very trendy and small Place, full of people, great atmosphere, I was waiting for 1 person table 1 hour to find out that the food is very basic to my opinion, papaya salad we great.
540.name: Ido M

541.review: We love the good here, have to stop here everytime we are in NYC !
541.name: Sirinuch Nichols

542.review: Great Thai food and reasonably priced
542.name: Dougie Willins

543.review: Good food. Service was pretty fast. I liked vegetarian dumplings, and fried rice.
543.name: Sarab Lamba

544.review: Outstanding Thai food and good value.
544.name: Mahmud Jamal

545.review: Food was fantastic. Atmosphere is great and staff are friendly.
545.name: Ken Perera

547.review: Food is overall very good, but the style is clearly altered to appeal to the American palate. You won't get any famous Thai spiciness here unless you ask, or it's explicitly marked on the menu. Very flexible about substitutions.
547.name: Elan Kugelmass

548.review: I had a craving for Thai food and this place really hit the spot! I came for dinner and waited for 45 minutes. I tried the curry puffs, pad thai, and pumpkin sticky rice. The puffs were amazing! They were soft and so delicious. I was only going to have one, but I couldn't help it and ate two. They are pretty sizable. The pad thai was just as good as you would imagine. The pumpkin sticky rice dessert was a real treat! If you like pumpkin flavored things, definitely try this out! It was delicious!
548.name: That L

549.review: Stumbled upon Pure Thai after seeing the insane crowd at the Ramen place around the corner. Pure Thai did not disappoint and was arguably the best Thai food I've ever had. The food was packed with flavor and the perfect amount of spice (I'm a believer in Thai food being a whole body experience, complete with beads of sweat). Their selection of Thai beers was appreciated, allowing me to order both of my favorites - Singha and Chang. Since leaving NYC, I think back on that meal and wish there was a Pure Thai close to home.
549.name: John M

550.review: Did takeout. Dumpling and papaya salad were good. The rest was so so.
550.name: Xinmei Cai

552.review: The best Pad Thai I have ever had. A little gem. Long wait times at peak hours.
552.name: Kiran reddy

553.review:
Best Thai food I've ever had. Their pad thai and chicken curry puffs are amazing. The prices are very reasonable, like other thai places.

The wait time is usually long, so if you're on a hurry, order online ($20 min).
553.name: Diego Cavalcanti

554.review:
Went to this restaurant for the first time and will not go back again! Disappointing! Gave 1 star because I wanted to leave a comment, otherwise, this restaurant doesn't deserve a star at all.
Awful food with very limited selection. Only 1 choice of dessert. Not authentic thai food. Portion of main couses were small and tasted worse than fast food. It was so awful that we didn't finish the main courses despite our hunger. 
Was extremely shocked when the waitress came back to inform us that our tips were insufficient as they charged 18% minimum. It was written on the bill that 18% tips for a  party of 5 and above but there were only 4 of us.
Service was not great and they didn't deserve even a 10% tips from us. Eventually we topped up the tips to 18%. My 3 friends and I unanimously agreed that we will not go back to this restaurant ever again!
554.name: Felicia Ong

555.review: Food was good. Didn't like that they say someone else at our table though.
555.name: Edward Valencia

556.review: Best Thai in Hell's kitchen. Authentic, fun atmosphere, and worth the wait.
556.name: Jonathan Wood

557.review: Best thai food in whole New York. I would recommend to reserve a table.
557.name: Marco

558.review:
Consider me unimpressed.

After a 30 minute wait and being literally crammed into bar seating, my friend and I ordered two Pad See Ews with beef as part of our annual New Year's Day meal. We were both disappointed. I did not like broccoli...the stems were too thick. There was too much sauce and the flavor was just off. I have had much better Thai throughout the city..I would go to Ruay Thai over here any day of the week.
558.name: Nikki Adelman

559.review: Found this place on Zomato and decided to check it out while on a daytrip to NYC.  This was the best Thai food I've had (ordered Chicken Pad Thai).  Portion was very generous and prices were cheaper than I am accustomed to paying in Connecticut.  Wait was about 35 minutes as the hostess had told us.  Once we were inside, we received very attentive and polite service.
559.name: Greg Kirby

560.review:
Ratchaburi Crab and Pork Dry Noodles is totally the way to go. The homemade egg noodles is where it's at. It has a nice texture and it works well in the dish. 

I also had the Sukhothai Pork Noodles which packs a whole lot of flavor in the broth. It's spicy and tangy and has a certain depth to it that's beyond your typical Tom Yum soup. 

Love it!
560.name: Regina Chan

561.review: Very busy we got takeaway so quality was not as good a hyped up to be. Decent meal
561.name: Roy Lambert

562.review: We truly did not mind the location we found it very quaint, HOWEVER, we DID mind the pad thai. Flavor was not good and the smell just hit our noses aaallll wrong.  Wanted something different to eat that night BUT that did not make the grade.  We ended up ordering another dish for my poor husband and we enjoyed the rest of the food.
562.name: FC Dee

563.review: Horribly rude and pretentious.  They're a tiny cramped place in a busy part of Manhattan.  They rush people in and out.  We were in a hurry, and my girlfriend was there ready to be seated and order for us so that the food would arrive around the time I did so we could eat and go.  They wouldn't seat her.
563.name: Clayburn Griffin

564.review: Good tahi eatery. The noodles are quite good. The service is fast but the place is usually packed at peak hours.
564.name: Jamie Matthews

565.review: This place is amazing. Service is quick and sweet, amazing place for perfect food!
565.name: Ella Erwin

566.review: My boyfriend and I visited this place randomly, there was a thirty minute wait but we are so glad we did. The food was savory and delicious, though the place is small this is the most delicious authentic Thai I've had in New York. Definitely will be back soon to try more dishes.
566.name: Sarah Fris

567.review: If you are looking for some tasty Thai cuisine that is not like your typical thai restaurant.  Stop by and try the noodles, I took the advice from the staff and had the "Ratchaburi Crab & Pork Dry Noodles" you can opt for the broth on the side.  You will not be disappointed.
567.name: Christopher Bacayon

569.review: "When will 9th avenue be renamed ""Little Thailand""? Regardless, Pure separates itself from the others by having a unique menu (yes, I'm saying that about a Thai restaurant) that has noodles in almost every way and spice level imaginable. Very tasty, and incredibly attentive service make return visits easy, though it can be cramped, and chairs would be better than stools. "
569.name: Andy Hollander

570.review: Excellent service, food , staff , atmosphere ETC
570.name: alex chino

571.review:
Excellent  authentic Thai food in a quirky whole in the wall type restaurant. Limited seating, though excellent service. 
If you love Thai food, you should give Pure Thai a shot.
571.name: Mandeep Gill

572.review: Great food and great price. The service is really good and fast.
572.name: Frank Pimentel

573.review: Service was a bit slow but the food was tasty.
573.name: alex oberoy

575.review:
I came with a friend and was totally impressed by this place.

Amazing Thai food at affordable price. Buzzy and lively environment, quick service.

What else do you need?
575.name: Jing Tang

576.review:
Is there any way to give 0 star???

Outrageous is my first and only impression to the way how this seemingly popular restaurant treated its customers. From the right beginning when we walked into this restaurant, the atmosphere didn't feel right. We were seen as 'invisible' by the staff there even though several tables were already cleaned up and ready to serve. The waitress skipped us anyway, and started serving the person who arrived after us. Hey, come on, are you blind???

We had to ask for being seated. However, you know what, we were even not allowed to choose where to seat. Funny, right?!

During the entire stay, we were treated as 'invisible'. No staff served us water, or, even made an apology for not being attentative. We were just treated like third-class citizens. 

Finally, we raised our voice to get the attention from everyone who was dining there. This time the staff there was no longer DEAF and BLIND. But again, they just don't care about customers. Their attitude just really made people sick and pissed off!

We didn't dine there at all, and left with disappointment!!!

So, we cannot speak for the food quality there. But, if you want to have 'invisible' experience, we will definitely recommend this restaurant!!!
576.name: MIKE R

577.review: Authentic Thai street food in an efficient locale with prompt service. #trendy
577.name: C. Alex Osteen

578.review: Great food, atmosphere is very lively. The place is pretty tiny though and you can expect some wait time during the weekends.
578.name: M K

579.review: Awesome experience & food for central NYC. So cheap as well!
579.name: Thomas Hill

580.review: Amazing Thai place. Pad see ew, curry and mango sticky rice highly recommended.
580.name: Isaac Katz

581.review: Delicious food but crowded inside the restaurant. I recommend ordering to go!
581.name: Helen Ye

582.review: Quick and friendly service and the food is amazing. Highly recommended!
582.name: James Cartwright

583.review: Pure Thai's menu differs from the ubiquitous standard Thai restaurant menu in a good way. Truly delicious every time I've been. Please open one on the east side!
583.name: Aaron Jeffries

584.review: The prizes are a little bit over average. The waitress wasn't happy with the tip and started to discuss in front of the other guests. Not acceptable.
584.name: Markus Kantauer

585.review: Omg the food!!!! Yummmmmmm! And great value for money! I would come back anytime!
585.name: Amrita O'Sullivan

586.review: The service was awful! We waited more than an hour and they gave away our table to another party that had arrived after us. They didn't even give us a call; it was only by pure luck that we checked in when we did. The food wasn't anything special and kind of overpriced for the portion size and quality. I would not come back.
586.name: Maryann Yin

588.review: My wife and I ordered the Beef Buns for an appetizer with Pad Thai and Pad See Ew for our entrées. Everything was absolutely delicious, including the teas we ordered. The staff was friendly and the atmosphere was lively. Loved it!
588.name: Denis Burr

589.review: A solid Thai spot in Hell's Kitchen, Pure Thai can get packed pretty easily and there's a reason why there are often lines out the door. The variety of food here is surprisingly solid across the board; the noodles, rice dishes, somtums, and soups are all delicious and served right out of the kitchen. Although seating is a little awkward with the brightly colored, metallic stools, it's worth a few moments of discomfort for the food.
589.name: Lori Luo

590.review: Great thai food. It is simply delicious. I and my friends really loved the dishes. We had to wait a bit but the food made the waiting worth the time. The price is ok, after all this is NYC. Portions are decent. The food comes out quite quickly. Personally, loved all the dishes. Friends said it was ok. Overall, everyone was satisfied.
590.name: pureum kim

591.review: Very rude customer service the wait staff is very impolite, very small restaurant .when we were halfway through our meal , they kept rushing us to pay our check . They did not even say excuse me they stretched their whole body in your face without even saying excuse me and start clearing the table. They seemed in a hurry or a rush to get us out of there  to get the next set of people in. We felt like animals getting ready to be slaughtered.
591.name: MAUREEN BELISLE-LEONG

592.review: Small space.  Expect long waits but the food is totally worth it.
592.name: Sue Lee

593.review: The best thai food in Hell's Kitchen. And that's saying a lot. Good delivery too.
593.name: Mitch Roth

594.review: Their tofu is some of the best I've ever had. Really nice and flavourful dishes.
594.name: Lamya Ezzeldin

595.review: Top notch. Get ready for next level spicy if you order a soup
595.name: Yoni Kavakeb

596.review: There are a TON of Thai restaurants on this strip of Ninth avenue and this noodle shop is hands down the best. While the others are dishing out typical options like tom yum soup and pad kee mao -this joint is doing more interesting takes on traditional fare. The dry noodles with pork and crab  are excellent. The narrow room can get crowded - it's best when you're in the mood for solo dining - there's usually a single stool available at the counter.
596.name: James Mulcahy

597.review: Pad Me Bo-Lan was great!! Always a wait. Get the Thai iced tea too!
597.name: Guha Arunkumar

598.review: Great tofu noodles for the price.
598.name: Abiram N

599.review: I am a picky person when it comes to thai. this food is authentic and delicious and high quality for inexpensive price. Finally found a good thai place!!
599.name: Ijeoma Nwaogu

600.review: Super authentic Thai food that is absolutely delicious, but doesn't hold back on the spice. Seriously, I made the mistake once of assuming that it was your garden variety bland Thai place and ordered the extra spicy and was tearing up with every bite. But having said that, they do their basics well: the pad se ew was probably the best rendition I've had in midtown and they also offer other dishes on their menu that isn't listed in your average Thai place. The place is tiny but cute, and great if you ever need a dose of Thai pop music in your life. It's my go-to place whenever friends come to town, and I almost don't want to post this because then I'd have to share this place with more people.
600.name: Penny Zhu

602.review:
Very authentic Thai food.  

Had the pad prig khing.  Ordered spicy and loved it
602.name: Ken Miller

603.review: Good prices and great food. True thai flavours and the best duck noodle soup in hells kitchen.
603.name: Hugo Palomares

604.review: Food is excellent!! BUT the wait is unbelievably long and the information about it is nor clear neither accurate, on several occasions. A pity that's the service is so disappointing.
604.name: Julie Lagauzere

606.review: I had a wonderful experience, food and service were excellent.i would recommend this  place to the entire world. We had a party of 6 and only waited 10 mins but i overheard the waiter telling a party of 2 that the waiting time was almost and hour for them.
606.name: dionisio diaz

607.review: Good service but foods are too sweet
607.name: solo sign

608.review: Best Thai food in NYC!! The ratchaburi dry noodles with pork and crab is to die for and so is the Thai Iced tea 😊👍
608.name: Girish Ramdas

609.review: Good food, restaurant very narrow so all tables are close together, Food very good and reasonably priced for NY
609.name: John Maughan

610.review: Small premises but food is authentic. Good ambience.
610.name: Grace Lee

611.review: Awesome food. Don't forget to ask what is the special of the day, you might get surprised!
611.name: Hector Oseguera

612.review: Come here for awesome, authentic Thai food! I highly recommend the Ratchaburi crab thai noodles. They are simple yet tasty. Prices are also reasonable, but expect a wait.
612.name: Lisa Cao

613.review: The best Thai kitchen in New York
613.name: ישראל יניב

615.review: Very small, so you'll have to wait if you go here.  Food was good, service was good.  I'd go to it again but it wasn't anything special to me.
615.name: Chris Marino

616.review: Place to be. Cannot guarantee that you can get in. Open for lunch at 12:00 and full by 12:05. But if you are the lucky one, it is worth it.
616.name: Sujarit Chermsirivatana

617.review:
Delicious duck noodles soup 
Staffs are friendly
617.name: Leisurely Grass

619.review: Very nicely done dishes, properly seasoned and gloppy like at most Thai places. To bad the vegetarian options are quite limited.
619.name: Gregor J. Rothfuss

620.review: I would come here just for the thai iced team. I stumbled upon this place while I was waiting for Totto ramen for too long and I just walked down the street to eat something.  This place is cozy and personal, and if I'm in the area, I'd definitely go again. After being robbed from noodles, I decided to get some noodle soup dishes. Not bad at all... I was rather pleased of the quality and this place exceeded my expectations
620.name: Clemens Wan

621.review: Amazing Thai food I'm a hole in the wall style restaurant. We told them we had a show to see in an hour and our food was brought out to us within 10 minutes of ordering.
621.name: Teddy Soares

622.review: Good real thai food, nice ambient and friendly staff. My recomondation
622.name: Silvan S.

623.review: Very cozy place :) very street food style! One of the better Thai places in New York!
623.name: Susie Su

624.review:
I'm not well knowledge in Thai street food. 

My gf's Pad See Ew was heavy on the sauce. I got the fresh pulled noodles with pork. 

Seating is small and limited. 

Bathroom has a sliding door. I want for my bathroom. 

I'd come back for those noodles again and the hipster vibe.
624.name: Christian Lau

625.review:
A hole-in-the-wall, reasonably priced place with mouth-watering food. There's usually a wait time, but they do agree on taking your orders before hand, while you're waiting,  so that the food arrives right after you're seated.   Probably depends on the Matire d', but worth a try as it saves time.

 Their 'Fried Rice With Lump Crab Meat' is to die for! Jungle curry fried rice, although slightly spicy is amazing too.  Thai ice tea is another favorite.  One of the best I've had in town. 'Wok Chilli Turmeric with Chicken' is good too.  My most favourite thai restaurant in town!
625.name: Rashmi Joishi

626.review: wait was not too long, atmosphere and decor is urban environmental chic. service is quick, friendly and efficient and the food is scrumptious!
626.name: Ms Sparkles

627.review: Disappointing.  Couldn't finish the chicken satay, chicken was rubbery.  Main course was better - sauce had good flavor, shrimp was okay.
627.name: Grayson Witcher

628.review: Best Pad Thai I've ever had in my life hands down.
628.name: Jaime D

629.review: Love this place! Hate to wait in line for a table (can get up to 30 min wait!!), but the food is worth it. Prices are O.K and the service is quick.
629.name: Yael Rimon

630.review: Not your traditional Thai place. The menu is great and the specials never disappoint. Well worth the long waits at times.
630.name: Randy Diaz

631.review: Was very busy and food was just OK IMO. Service was great, unusual for a Thai place, lol
631.name: Robert K

632.review: Nice place, very good Thai food. Try the noodles
632.name: GianPaolo Blasone

633.review: Recently came with my girlfriend (who is Thai), and we really enjoyed the three dishes we got: Nakorn Pathom Duck (we replaced rice noodles with egg noodles), Sukhothai Pork Noodle, Ratchaburi Noodle with Crab and roast pork. My girlfriend guaranteed me that it is extremely close to what she would have at home! I also really liked the Thai Iced Tea, possibly the best I've had in the city thus far.
633.name: Nicola Benatti

634.review: Noodle soup is tastier than the dry noodles. Chicken curry puffs are good too
634.name: Andrew Levine

635.review: Don't expect to lean back on your chair or have a good place for your coat. Awesome peanut sauce and dumplings
635.name: Jenna Leder

636.review: The quality and authenticity of the food here really sets it apart from the many other Thai venues on 9th avenue. Come here for the noodle soups and also get the Thai iced tea or iced coffee here: the crushed ice that it's served with here really keeps the consistency of the drink (instead of having a watered down drink at the end when using regular ice).
636.name: Emily Chu

637.review: Everything we ordered was unreasonably spicy. My fish ball soup was almost inedible. Still laughing about it. Service was good.. very friendly..
637.name: Jared Wick

639.review: Great food, service and everything else.
639.name: Tim Fink

640.review: Small, cozy spot, very attentive polite service... Ordered Beef Buns (Fine), Wok Chili Pepper with Chicken (Good), Nakorn-Patom Duck Noodles Soup (Very Good).
640.name: Jack Bloom

641.review: Good Thai food option at very decent prices. Loved the spice level adjustments to suit my extra heat loving taste buds.
641.name: Rahul Narvekar

642.review: I highly recommend this place, for its delicious food, for the decent  price and big serving.
642.name: Ke Z

643.review: Authentic Thai soup bowls! Very interesting flavors. Different from other Americanized Thai restaurants.
643.name: Paul Cheong

644.review: The soups are pretty close to what I had in Thailand. The food is excellent.
644.name: Chris Reilly

645.review:
I've never been to a thai place in NYC that has a menu like this.  Having gone to Thailand for a food trip, it seems like 1/3 of the menu has dishes from Northern Thailand (educated guess).  I'd say it's pretty authentic as they use real Thai ingredients instead of substitutes like kaffir lime leaves, lots of tamarind and even Thai eggplants (small green round eggplants the size of a lemon).

Everything was cooked very well and had distinct clean flavors.  We got the spring rolls, fresh rolls (these were interesting and yummy, try them!), curry paste with pork, and the ratchaburi noodles (totally mispelling...) with pork and crab.  The noodles were simple and light.  The pork was tender.  I got the noodles dish because it was recommended on yelp so often but I don't think I would get it again as I want something with a little more flavor.

I took my friends leftover curry paste with pork today, and wow, it's spicy but I believe she added extra spice.  It is a very flavorful, authentic Thai dish.

Prices are good too.  With two appetizers (7-10 each), two meals (12 each), a bottle of wine, tax and 20% tip, the bill was about $80 for two people.

I would definitely recommend it if you want a different, authentic type of Thai place.
645.name: Sarah Kim ig lusttilldawn

646.review: Miss rice noodle sooooooo much. Now had one of the best in nyc. Iced Thai tea would be better if not sweet like now.
646.name: Lillian J

647.review: Quality Thai dishes that are step above many of the other Thai offerings in Hell's Kitchen. The Papaya Salad is fantastic, but the highlight was the dessert special Yam Custard.
647.name: Mike Winston

648.review: Darn good Thai food! Had the papaya salad (hot and delish) noodles which were like ramen noodles (they're hand made). Highly recommended.
648.name: Jeff Sieben

649.review: The best Thai food I have ever had with non-NY pricetag.
649.name: Seunghyun Kim

650.review: It's a little out of the way for pre-theater dining, but if you have enough time, it's worth the trek.The dry noodles with pork and crab are stellar - an absolute must. Since the space is fairly narrow and small, to avoid a wait, try going at lunch.
650.name: Jacqueline Wasilczyk

651.review: It's quite small but serves great noodles and has a good lunch special
651.name: Abdul Salam

652.review: The atmosphere and the great noodle soup always bring me as close to BKK that I've found this side of the world. Love it!
652.name: Thomas Wysocki

654.review: Incredibly small and busy, but it's worth the wait for some of the best Thai I've ever had.
654.name: Mark Bennett

655.review: Small place but Thai food over here will remind of you being somewhere else
655.name: rahul gupta

656.review: Gtreaaat food and nice service there! Strongly recommend the baby back ribs;)
656.name: Zijing Wu

657.review: Great food, great service! Small place, not good for groups
657.name: Tyler Thurston

658.review: They were able to get us in quickly, and the noodles were amazing.
658.name: Tony Walt

659.review: Amazing food!! The place is cozy but the design is nice.
659.name: Xin Zhang

661.review: Got the Pad-se-ew. Was decent, nothing amazing. Good quick food though.
661.name: Mani Castillo

662.review: Tasteful and attentive. Will come back.
662.name: Teddy Kyung

663.review: Seemingly authentic and cozy Thai food
663.name: Anthony Muljadi

664.review: Great food if you are used to strong Thai cooking flavors
664.name: Girish Lakade

665.review: Not vegetarian friendly. Menu has just a few things without fish sauce or meat, and they're not very exciting. I got the Pad Mee Bo-Lan With Vegetables, which was just bad -- the other three at the table all agreed that it was too.
665.name: Bradley Coleman August

666.review: If you hold yourself and wait 10 min to get a table or seat at the bar you will inmerse in a real thai experience. The pad thai is awesome and the correct size. The spring rolls are a great apt. We loved that we can change the meat or vegetables options. The have tai beers and the people here is super friendly, in tune with the happy tai music.
666.name: Jesi Mac Leod

667.review: Charming. Love the Thai music! Be careful of ordering SPICY. Opt fo rmedium. Best vegetarian dumplings!
667.name: David Ninh

669.review: Cramped seating and long waits. The food was fine and the prices fair, but nothing I hadn't had at other Thai restaurants before. A good choice if you can get in quickly, but not worth any inconvenience.
669.name: Javier Kohen

671.review: Super small space but the food is top notch
671.name: Steven Lemeshow

672.review:
I've been meaning to hit up Pure Thai Cookhouse for quite some time now. Luckily a few friends of mine were up for a authentic Thai experience. Inside looks as what they like to call a "shophouse". With wood paneling, industrial decor and a modern flair... this place is right up my alley. It's also built with a vertically oriented layout. How they fit so much seating in such little space? I'll never know.

We arrived at about 6pm on a Friday and were lucky enough to get the last seat right in the front. They brought us a nice sized carafe of water and kept our glasses full. And I now know why. I ended up ordering the Wok Basil with Chicken. Now I see that you can customize your spice level and I've never eaten there before... I'll settle on medium**. That way I can gauge for next time whether to amp it up or not. All I can say is, wow. The ground chicken and string beans were a killer. I think that chili garlic puree and holy basil sauce did a number on me. The only thing to tame the heat was that jasmine rice. Don't get me wrong, it was delicious and I'd order it again. But no 3 stars for me. I'll stick to a happy 2. 

We also ordered:
-The Chicken Curry Puffs: super flaky/crispy with a moist center. (With sweet potato, onion and a cucumber relish.)

-Steamed Veggie Dumplings:My favorite app. From the looks of it, I had no idea how it was going to taste as well as texture-wise. The peanut flavor was strong which I enjoyed. Pillow-y and flavorful bites.

I received a fairly amount of hype for PTC and was happily surprised to see that it's completely justified and warranted here. Service was great and we didn't feel rushed despite the incoming crowds. I appreciated the atmosphere that transported me across the world and the bold flavors that took my taste buds there as well.
672.name: Katie Harman

673.review:
New fav thai place in the city, hands down.  They don't sell the typical thai "americanized" food.  The restaurant has a nice authentic vibe where the staff say their greetings in Thai as you enter.  I came right before the dinner rush, on a rainy Wednesday it was still pretty crowded.  The restaurant is small, so I wouldn't recommend you bringing a huge group of people here.  There is a seating area along the aisle as you enter, but you will definitely bump into some people as you go in and out.  

As you wait, there are tempting thai treats along the walls and in the front -- so you can snack as you wait.  My wait wasn't that long, so I was just looking around.

There are seats along the wall as a bar, so if you want to sit face-to-face maybe you should not come as a party of 3 or you'll probably be seated there.  If you're sitting along the bar, there will be hooks below for your things and more hooks along the opposite wall.

There are specials along the walls on a chalkboard too.  The staff were quick to respond because they want you there in and then quickly out so they can sit next parties.

I had the duck soup noodle and it was delicious.  The duck had enough fat and meat to taste and I wanted to drink the entire soup because of it's not too salty, but definitely refreshing taste.  The noodles weren't soggy and just had the amount of bite to them.  It wasn't too filling and it wasn't too light -- portioned just right I felt like I ate a healthy meal. I absolutely loved their hot sauce they added on the side and dumped the entire thing in the bowl.  Yum.

Next time I come I will definitely try their beautiful thai iced tea!
673.name: Pinky Chan

674.review: Great Thai food.  You can't loose!
674.name: Althea Woolcock

675.review: Friendly atmosphere with good lunch menu.
675.name: Nam Nguyen

676.review: Super tasty and portions are not ridiculous so you can focus on the flavor.
676.name: Patrick Wynn

677.review: Probably one of the best Thai Kitchens in the city and definitely the best Thai food in midtown.
677.name: Marc Lucas

678.review: Great food!  Almost as good as i make at home.
678.name: Ryan Blakeslee

679.review: Great authentic Thai food in Manhattan.
679.name: Morgan Lai

680.review: Amazing! Life Changing! Extravagante! The Best Service I have ever had and I can say I've had really good service before! I had the chicken curry puffs for an appetizer. Then the Wok Chilli Pepper with Tulmeric for a main entrée. All my food came within about less than 15 minutes and it was pretty crowded. The food was great and I even snuck in a few chicken puffs into my bag. I ordered the mango rice cakes for desert and that was honestly the icing on the cake.
680.name: Eni Awowale

681.review: The best Thai restaurant in the city.
681.name: JP Bernardo

682.review: Excellent flavors not your typical dumb down thai food.
682.name: Philip Trageser

683.review: I tried the ratchaburi pork and crab noodles, krabi seafood noodle soup, and sukhothai. They were all very bold in terms of flavor. I liked the sweetness of the ratchaburi noodles. The spicy vinegary flavor of the krabi soup did not seem to mesh with the medley of seafoods cohesively. The sukhothai was an excellent dish with a good amount of sour and salty. 703.review:
Overall, giving this place 3 stars because out of 3 dishes, only 1 succeeded. For 2 people, we waited for about 45 minutes.  We ordered the chicken curry puffs, beef salad, and pad see ew.

We sat at the bar and surprisingly service was somewhat decent.  The food took awhile to get to us though.

The chicken curry puffs came out first and biting into it, flavors were bland, not much curry kick, and the flour seemed under cooked.  I think previous reviewers liked the softness of it and it not being overly fried but I think it's actually under cooked.  Dish was very underwhelming.  Something that I didn't expect for thai food. 

The beef salad was much much better.  The meat was about medium rare which was good.  I don't like it when the beef is like jerky, that's just terrible.  I'm glad that they did not screw up such a simple dish.  It's usually the simple dishes that are really hard to do right.  All the components of the salad worked together but I wish there was mangoes in it.  The apples were sweet enough.  My only complaint is the little white "rocks" seasoning, I forgot what it's called but it gives texture to the dish.  However, it got stuck in my teeth and it felt like chewing on sand.  I think they should replace it with peanuts.  It's a good dish, but it needs refinement.

Lastly, the pad see ew.  Noodles were excellent, dish was too sweet for me and the meat was like jerky.  I think if they didn't cook the meat that long and just made it medium rare, this would have been a better well rounded dish.  I think they cooked the meat separately, then again when the noodles were being cooked.  

One surprising thing was they every now and then they would refill our glasses with water even though we were sitting at the bar.  I was happy with that.

Overall, this place really lacked flavor in the dishes that we had.  Something I don't expect from a thai place.  I expect bold strong flavors.  I've never been to thailand but I doubt their authentic dishes were bland in flavor.  I also have a suspicion that the noodles here on average is not their strong suit.  I think their wok or rice dishes would be better.  I will try that if I come here again.

I would recommend The Sea in Brooklyn over this place any day.

Not much room inside, so avoid arrival at peak. You can order takeaway.

Pour moi, une des meilleures adresses Thaï de NY.
